10013.description: We are currently looking for volunteers who are passionate about helping homeless abuse survivors improve financial literacy. This is a support role, working with a team to create materials and content for our classes. Research & Material Development Support Conducting research in preparation for classes and programs. Assist Cacilitators and Team Lead in designing activities and handouts for classes. Assistance in material purchases or print-outs for sessions. Qualifications: Ability and willingness to work in a team environment. Keen, creative eye for design and user experience. Timely and detail oriented. Receptive to receiving and giving feedback. Proficiency with PowerPoint and/or other design software tools to create handouts. Weekly Commitment: 2 hours Please send emails to: myan@shine-foundation.org to apply
10013.title: Research & Material Development-Help Homeless Abuse Survivors Improve Financial Literacy (NYC)

10013.description: Team Lead: We are currently looking for individuals passionate about making a difference to join Shine as team leads to help bridge the gap between Shine and our clients and partner sites. Responsibilities: Team leads will serve as main point of contact between site contact, team and Shine Board Work with facilitators and to create program and lesson plans Coordinate all team members - virtual and in-person facilitators, support, graphic designer and marketing specialist. Approve lesson plans and handouts. Provide regular progress updates on the program to site contact and Shine Board Ensure proper data collection for monitoring and evaluation. Qualifications: Experience managing multifunctional teams. 5+ years of prior project management experience. Highly organized and detailed oriented. Ability to make decisions and move processes forward. Timeframe: One-year Weekly commitment: 8 to 10 hours To apply: Send resumes to: myan@shine-foundation.org
10013.title: Team Lead: opportunity to help homeless abuse survivors improve financial literacy

10451.description: The Damon Runyon Cancer Research Foundation is currently seeking volunteers for the eighth annual Runyon 5K at Yankee Stadium. Volunteering is a fun way for friends, co-workers and family members to take part in this unique event and we need your help to knock it out of the park! We're looking for enthusiastic and reliable people to help out with everything from set-up and breakdown to cheering on participants as they run or walk a 5K through Yankee Stadium. We welcome individuals as well as corporate and community groups for what promises to be a great day in support of young scientists and innovative cancer research. Most of the volunteer activities take place on the day of the event - S aturday, July 15, from 7am until approximately 2pm. Breakfast and lunch will be provided.
10451.title: Runyon 5K at Yankee Stadium

10451.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at The Concourse PLaza Multiplex. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10451.title: Volunteer for the Jimmy Fund at Concourse Plaza Multiplex in Bronx, NY!

10451.description: South Bronx United is seeking energetic individuals with a passion for youth development and sports to join the Americorps Up2Us Coaching program. Each South Bronx United Americorps Up2Us member will serve as the Team Mentor and head or assistant soccer coach for a team of youth within the SBU Academy Program. In addition to mentoring and coaching a competitive soccer team, the Up2Us member will have an additional focus area, either helping with coordination and coaching of SBU’s Community Soccer Programs OR assisting with coordination and program delivery of the SBU After School Tutoring/College Prep Programs. Up2Us members will have the opportunity to see the inner working of a small, growing non-profit and gain professional experience and skills in the fields of education, teaching, counseling, and coaching. This is a part time position requiring approximately 15-20 hours/week. A living stipend will be offered in accordance with the AmeriCorps part-time position policies. Those who complete the year long Americorps term in support of South Bronx youth, also receive an educational award to go towards future or past educational loans. Additionally, those who complete the year will be considered for further paid SBU coaching positions. In addition to site-specific duties at South Bronx United, members are also responsible for the following Up2Us program requirements: Completing timesheets; Attending the Up2Us National Coaching Institute, Attending professional development and training seminars every other month; Reflecting on their work in guided reflection logs; and Participating in a National Day of Service. The Americorps Up2Us program is an intense experience and members are asked to go above and beyond each and every day at their host site (South Bronx United). Being a part of the Up2Us program connects members both with their local communities and a larger national movement of people dedicated to serving youth through sports. Responsibilities As a Team Mentor & Coach, the Americorps member will: -Serve as first point of staff level contact for a group of approx 20 youth (mentees) -Help plan, set, and keep students on their program schedule -Maintain weekly contact with each mentee in person and via phone -Maintain regular contact with mentees’ parent(s)/guardian(s) -Monitor student academic performance, and assist in the collection of student report cards, transcripts, and school documents -Work with SBU Youth Counselor and Education Director to identify social, emotional, and academic issues or concerns -Check email daily and maintain good communication with SBU office staff -Enforce attendance and program policies -Serve as a head or assistant coach for 1 SBU travel soccer team, planning and leading training sessions, coaching at games, and travelling with students to games and events. -Track attendance data from soccer and academic sessions. -Complete progress reports for each mentee two times per year. Additionally Americorps Up2Us Coaches will either: -Assist with coordination and program delivery of the After School Tutoring Program and/or College Prep program, helping managing the learning environment, tracking student attendance and providing direct academic support OR -Assist with the coordination of the SBU recreational program, supporting volunteer soccer coaches, leading recreational practices, and helping with coach trainings. Location* SBU Office: South Bronx United, 594 Grand Concourse, Suite 2, Bronx, NY 10451 Academic Site: Urban Assembly School for Careers in Sports, 730 Concourse Village West, Bronx, NY Primary Soccer Site: Macomb’s Dam Park, 161st Street, Bronx, NY 10451 *Most service will be performed at soccer or academic sites Schedule The term of service runs August 1, 2017-July 31, 2018. The following hours are approximate, times may change slightly. Team Coach & Mentor w/Soccer Focus -T/Th, 6-8pm (Academy Soccer Practice) -T/W/Th, 3:30-6pm (Recreational Practice) OR Sat, 8-3pm (Recreational Games) -Sun (dependent on game schedules) Team Coach & Mentor w/Academic Focus -M/W, 5:30-8pm OR T/Th, 3:30-6pm (Tutoring/College Prep) -T/Th, 6-8pm (Academy Soccer Practice) -Sat or Sun (dependent on game schedules) Compensation Coaches will receive a $7,770 living stipend for their service over the course of 12 months as well as an educational award of $2,907 to go towards loan repayment or future educational costs. All HR related matters are handled by Up2Us. Learn more about the Up2Us program at https://www.up2us.org/coach- across-america Qualifications Enthusiastic to work with youth, committed to holistic youth development with a strong knowledge of soccer. Previous coaching experience is not a necessity. Coach/Mentors with an Academic Focus should have a strong academic background and feel comfortable with SAT level Math and English. How to Apply To apply email info@southbronxunited.org with a cover letter and resume
10451.title: Team Mentor & Coach - Americorps Up2Us

10451.description: OVERVIEW The Coach Across America staff member would become a Team Mentor for one or two teams of youth within the SBU Academy Program. She/he would serve as an assistant or head coach for one or two teams, help with coordination of the SBU Recreational Soccer Program, and assist with program delivery of the SBU After School Tutoring or College Prep Programs for middle and high school students. Team mentors are the first point of contact for issues or questions concerning a youth on their team. This is a part time position requiring approximately 20-25 hours/week. A living stipend will be offered in accordance with the AmeriCorps part-time position policies. The Coach Across America program is operated by Up2Us. In addition to site-specific duties, Coach Across America Coaches are also responsible for the following Up2Us CAA program requirements: Completing timesheets; Attending professional development and training seminars; Reflecting on their work in guided reflection logs; and Participating in a National Day of Service Coach Across America is an intense experience and Coaches are asked to go above and beyond each and every day. Being a part of Coach Across America connects Coaches both with their local communities and a larger national movement of people dedicated to serving youth through sports. RESPONSIBILITIES As a Team Mentor, individual will: * Serve as a mentor and adviser for 18-40 youth on 1-2 soccer teams. * Set and communicate their mentees’ program schedule and plan, * Collect report cards, transcripts, and school documents, * Maintain weekly contact with each mentee in person and via phone, * Maintain regular contact with mentees’ parent/guardian * Communicate with students’ schools or outside programs as needed, * Work with SBU youth counselor and education staff to identify social, emotional, and academic issues or concerns * When applicable, collaborate with Education Director and Director of College Placement and Alumni, to support students with high school and college placement process (including public, charter, parochial, prep, and boarding schools). * Serve as a head or assistant coach for 1-2 SBU travel soccer teams, planning and leading training sessions, coaching at games, and traveling with students to games and events. * Track attendance data from soccer and academic sessions. * Complete progress reports for each mentee two times per year. * Assist with the After School Tutoring and/or College Prep programs, tutoring youth, managing the learning environment, and tracking student attendance. * Help supervise the SBU Recreational Soccer Program on Saturday mornings/afternoons, setting up the field space and games, overseeing youth participants, and supporting volunteer rec coaches & referees. * Assist with several major SBU events including volunteer appreciation nights, an end of the year awards ceremony, a winter celebration, the City Showcase Tournament and Symposium, and the SBU Annual Benefit. LOCATION South Bronx United, 594 Grand Concourse, Suite 2, Bronx, NY 10451 SCHEDULE The following hours are approximate, times may change: * Tuesdays & Thursdays, 3:30-8:00pm * Saturdays & Sunday mornings/afternoons for games and leagues COMPENSATION Coaches will receive a $7,700 living stipend (approx) for their service over the course of 12 months, as well as an educational award of $2,865 (approx) upon completion of service to go towards loan repayment or future educational costs. All HR related matters are handled by Up2Us and AmeriCorps. Learn more about the CAA program at https://www.up2us.org/coach-across-america How to Apply Email info@southbronxunited.org with a cover letter and resume. Please put \"Americorps Team Mentor\" in the subject line.
10451.title: Soccer Coach & Team Mentor - Americorps CAA Program

10456.description: This is our second year of running the Family Sports Day, which has proved to be a successful event. Co-ordinators needed for the day to help run activites and make sure all participants are aware of what is going on. Also to keep a tally of scores.
10456.title: Sports Co-Ordinators

10456.description: We will be holding our Annual Family Sports Day on July 22, 2017 and need help with managing the children (and adults!), helping out with sports, serving and grilling food; assisting with general organization on that day. We also need some face painters.
10456.title: GAN Family Sports Day!

10455.description: Breaking Ground is looking for four (4) to help set up, serve food and drinks, interact with tenants, take photos, help with clean-up, etc. for our residents at the Brook. The Brook is Breaking Ground's first residence in the Bronx, which provides supportive housing for 120 formerly homeless single adults, many of whom have special needs.
10455.title: Independence Day BBQ  at the Brook

10455.description: Masa is seeking dedicated volunteers who are interested in working as part of a team to help support our six-week Summer STEM program where Masa Scholars will hone their creativity and engineering skills by designing innovative robots with a focus towards the local community. The Summer STEM Program will end with an interactive showcase open to students and their families. Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx). When: The Summer Robotics Program will begin on July 10th, 2017 and will end on August 17th, 2017. Time: The Summer Robotics Program will operate on Mondays and Tuesdays from 10:30 am - 1:30 pm, and Wednesdays and Thursdays from 10:30 am - 1:00 pm. What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to help support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer at least once a week on a consistent basis. Willingness to work with scholars going into grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12). Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date. Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor. Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction. Attend summer interactive showcase (if schedule permits). Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff. Fill out volunteer application and attend a meeting/interview with Masa staff. HOW TO APPLY Visit our interest form: bit.ly/masa-vol Email us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: Volunteer at a Summer Robotics Program!

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer math program! By tutoring for 1.5 hours a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education -one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our summer literacy program, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 4-6 to help improve their literacy and math skills, and prevent a summer slide! About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and families to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy/STEM Intensive Program: Starting in July, Masa will begin their six-week summer program to help support students going into grades 4-6 with their literacy and STEM. Students in this program are already struggling academically, so it's crucial that they receive additional instruction to help boost their confidence and prevent the \"summer slide\"! Volunteer Duties: · Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: o Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds o Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material o Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading · Work with small groups of students going into grades 4-6 to facilitate math/science activities · Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development · Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities · Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 4 PM - 5:30 PM beginning July 10th 2017 through August 17th 2017 Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed HOW TO APPLY Interested? Fill out our interest form at bit.ly/masa-vol For more information you may also visit: www.masany.org or e-mail us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: Help boost literacy skills for students in grades 4-6 this summer!

10455.description: Masa invites you to join our summer program! By tutoring for three hours a week you can be a part of the change. Join us in transforming communities through education - one family, one child at a time! We are seeking dedicated volunteers to be a part of our literacy initiative, 1.5 hours a week. Volunteers will work with students going into grades 1-3 to help improve their literacy skills, so they go into the next school year as confident learners and readers. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and family to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. About the Literacy Intensive program: During the summer, Masa will help students struggling in literacy to boost their phonemic awareness, vocabulary and reading comprehension. In the area where Masa operates, just 10% of third-graders read at grade level - so additional support is critical! Literacy volunteers will: Work with small groups of students going into grades 1-3 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: Work with students to identify, hear and manipulate sounds in words using games Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 2 pm to 3:30 pm beginning July 10th 2017 through August 17th 2017 Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed How to apply Fill out our interest form: bit.ly/masa-vol For more information, visit our website at www.masany.org, or email volunteeropportunities@masany.org
10455.title: Volunteer at a Summer Literacy Program: Grades 1-3

Literacy volunteers will: Work with small groups of students going into grades 1-3 to provide intensive literacy instruction, specifically: Work with students to identify, hear and manipulate sounds in words using games Support students in using tools to recognize the relationship between letters and sounds Practice fluent reading with students using instructional level reading material Perform daily read aloud to encourage reading comprehension and foster a love of reading Create an environment in which children develop trusting and accepting relationships with adults and peers that foster growth and development Collaborate in devising strategies for reinforcing material or skills based on an understanding of individual students, their needs, interests, and abilities Maintain and model high academic and personal expectations for all students Additional duties identified by Literacy Specialist as needed Volunteers should: Be available at least one afternoon a week Mondays through Thursdays from 2 pm to 3:30 pm beginning July 10th 2017 through August 17th 2017 Communicate observations regarding students' academic, social and behavioral status Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed How to apply Fill out our interest form: bit.ly/masa-vol For more information, visit our website at www.masany.org, or email volunteeropportunities@masany.org

10455.title: Help boost literacy skills for students in grades 4-6 this summer!

10455.description: Masa is seeking dedicated volunteers who are interested in working as part of a team to help support our six-week Summer STEM program where Masa Scholars will hone their creativity and engineering skills by designing innovative robots with a focus towards the local community. The Summer STEM Program will end with an interactive showcase open to students and their families. Where: Masa South Bronx Community Center, easily accessible by the 2 and 5 trains to the 149th Street-3rd Avenue train station (just 2 stops into the Bronx). When: The Summer Robotics Program will begin on July 10th, 2017 and will end on August 17th, 2017. Time: The Summer Robotics Program will operate on Mondays and Tuesdays from 10:30 am - 1:30 pm, and Wednesdays and Thursdays from 10:30 am - 1:00 pm. What: We are looking for dedicated volunteers to help support our Robotics instructor. Volunteers will help facilitate daily lesson plans and activities, as well as help manage participating scholars. Prior background in STEM or Robotics is NOT required but a strong interest and knowledge of STEM subjects is highly welcomed. TRAINING will be provided. Requirements are as follows: Ability to volunteer at least once a week on a consistent basis. Willingness to work with scholars going into grades 4 to 6 (ages 9 to 12). Attend a training which will take place prior to program start date. Willing and able to help facilitate lesson plans to students, in small group settings, and under the leadership of our Robotics instructor. Help manage behavior and lead scholars through daily instruction. Attend summer interactive showcase (if schedule permits). Provide feedback on student progress and/or concerns to Masa staff. Fill out volunteer application and attend a meeting/interview with Masa staff. HOW TO APPLY Visit our interest form: bit.ly/masa-vol Email us at volunteeropportunities@masany.org

10455.description: Come help out with childcare for a fun, sweet group of 10-15 kids while their parents are in an Organizing Committee meeting! By providing childcare on Thursdays from 6-8 PM over the summer months, you'll get to engage an awesome group of kids in play -- and ensure their parents are able to focus on the work of the Organizing Committee. About Masa: Masa is a non-profit organization that partners with Mexican and Latino children, youth and families to create strong learners and leaders who fully contribute to the broader community. Volunteer Duties: Childcare volunteers will engage with a group of students ages 18 months - 10 years old: play games, blocks, and trains; coloring and doing light art projects; and reading. Volunteers should: Be available most Thursdays from 6-8 PM, from June 8th - August 31st Enjoy working with children Be flexible, creative, organized and able to respond to change as needed
10455.title: This summer, help take care of fun, sweet kids on Thursdays!

10454.description: We have several projects in need of volunteers, each focusing on either, (1) online/ social media marketing, (2) donor outreach/ management, (3) partnership/ sponsorship building, or (4) public relations. Depending on your unique skill sets and project assignment, you may be responsible for: following up with community contacts in order to help build business-to-business relationships; creating captivating images or writing persuasive, fact-based articles for our quarterly newsletter; establshing a YouTube channel that strengthens our cyber presence. Bring your passion, talents and creativity to Every Day is a Miracle, and let's forward the fight against hunger together! Please send your resume to Maria Estrada, Executive Director at mestrada@edmnyc.org
10454.title: Communications Associate-give poverty a voice, a face, a story

10454.description: Through this position, volunteer(s) handle fundamental aspects of our financial record keeping processes, including but not limited to maintaining ledger entries, preparing financial statements, assisting with budget preparations/ reports, and assisting with 1099's and annual tax filings.
10454.title: Accounting/ Bookkeeping Volunteer needed

10454.description: On November 5th, 2015, Every Day is a Miracle will celebrate FILL THE PLATE--our annual gala to end hunger and eradicate poverty. Funds raised will benefit hunger-relief/ anti-poverty programs in the community. We are looking for volunteers to join our Event Committee and help us reach out to prospective sponsors, businesses, and donors for the gala. This is a great opportunity to gain real world experience with business relations, communications, marketing, fundraising, and event management. You must be able to exercise professionalism, be comfortable speaking with individuals in the corporate world, have a great phone presence, and be able to manage your time wisely when working on specific tasks. The hours are EXTREMELY flexible, however, we ask that you be reliable and commit to whatever schedule we agree upon. Join the team and let's start making a difference today!
10454.title: Development Intern—Help End Poverty

10459.description: We are looking a volunteer Citizenship teacher that can dedicate 2 hours on Fridays from 2 to 4pm Our organization is located in the South Bronx and we serve a large community of immigrants. Many of our clients seek to prepare for their upcoming Citizenship exam and interview. Our class was created to assist those students with preparing them for the 100 questions for the citizenship exam and the oral portion of the test. Students also learn about American culture and history and enhance their abilities to read, write, and speak English. We are looking for someone that has worked in a small group setting before. Preferrably speaks 2 or more languages, has the ability to create and/or follow a curriculum, prepare and grade student work. This person must be reliable and follows the schedule agreed upon at the time of volunteering. Someone that has experience with preparing documents for the citizenship test would be a plus. We are looking for a volunteer that will be dependable and able to teach every Friday (excluding holidays) for each 6 week session (two in total): Class dates are TBD and class times are preferred 3-5pm but can be negotiated. We ofcourse are happy to have someone that will be willing to work longterm as a volunteer teacher but atleast expect 2 sessions covered each term. We provide groceries twice a month to the volunteer teacher as a thank you.
10459.title: Bilingual Civics Teacher
10459.org: The HopeLine Resource Center for Community Development

10458.description: The Care Management program is seeking Data Entry Specialists who are able to perform extensive data entry into 3 different electronic health records and a variety of Microsoft Excel spreadsheets in order to accurately track and manage the care coordination services provided to our clients. We seek volunteers who: - Are computer literate and knowledgeable of recent Microsoft Excel updates. - Have experience with data entry. - Are able to treat Protected Health Information confidentially & with good judgment. - Are willing to be trained to utilize electronic health records. This opportunity is available on Mondays-Fridays from 9am-5pm. Time commitment and hours are flexible within the hours of operation.
10458.title: Data Entry Specialist
10458.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

07740.description: Assist MOCEANS Center for Independent Living (https://www.moceanscil.org/) staff members manning a table/booth at OCEANFEST. Distribute brochures and flyers advertising the services provided by MOCEANS on behalf of persons with disabilities. You will be provided with a basic set of information about MOCEANS's mission to help answrer questions, and refer people requesting information to MOCEANS staff, which will be on site. Volunteer shifts are between 10:00 AM - 6;00 PM, with a minimum of 2 hours and a maximum of 4 hours per shift. All times are available. OCEANFEST is the premiere yearly fair/event for the JERSEY Shore and this is the perfect opportunity to help spread word of the services and assistance available to those with disabilities as provided byMOCEANS Center for Independent Living. MOCEANS is a certified 501(c)3 charitable organization.
07740.title: OCEANFEST 2017 (Long Branch NJ)- Help distribute materials for MOCEANS Center for Independent Living
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07740.description: Did you know that colorectal cancer is the 2nd leading cause of cancer death in the US, yet it is one of the most preventable forms of cancer? By volunteering for our 5k, the Undy Run/Walk you can help change that! We have found that by getting people talking about this disease, we can save lives. Date: Saturday, July 15, 2017 Location: The Great Lawn at Pier Village, Long Branch, NJ HOW WE NEED YOUR HELP THE DAY OF THE EVENT: -Early Shift- Set up expo area Registration and runner check in Food & Beverage Tent Kids Fun Zone -Later Shift- Water stations Course cheering Course marshaling Clean Up Event Photographer Please note we are also happy to validate or confirm any hours needed for school or community service. About The Colon Cancer Alliance: The Colon Cancer Alliance is a community that provides hope and support to patients and their families, while saving lives through prevention, research, and patient support services. www.ccalliance.org TO SIGN UP AS A VOLUNTEER, CONTACT: Joanna Anastasio, Special Events Coordinator janastasio@ccalliance.org 202.207.0267
07740.title: Help Us Kick Colon Cancer's Butt - Volunteer for the Jersey Shore Undy Run/Walk

07740.description: The Nonprofit Management Intern will assist the Executive Director in all aspects of nonprofit management including but not limited to strategic planning, revenue generation, public relations, event planning, and fundraising. Business management Actively engage MOCEANS’ volunteers, board members, event committees, alumni, partnering organizations, and funders Support Board of Directors, as needed Track progress and measure successes that can be effectively communicated to the board, funders, and other stakeholders Analytics and reporting Compile all data and necessary reports to comply with State and Federal guidelines Track donor and community engagement in company database, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail Maintain and update company information resource files as a complete, organized and usable database of members, donors, funders, and other community stakeholders Capacity-building Execute strategic business planning processes for program expansion Research prospective donors and funding sources, building strong community partnerships Expand revenue-generating and fundraising activities to support existing program operations and regional expansion Plan and support fundraising events, as needed Qualifications Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Public Administration, or similar Advanced computer skills including typing, Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Apps Ability to relate effectively with the public, fellow staff, and members in a professional manner Excellent verbal, written, and organizational skills Proficiency using at least one social media channel preferred
07740.title: Nonprofit Management Intern - Summer 2017
07740.org: MOCEANS Center for Independent Living, Inc.

07746.description: This is an internship or volunteer position, great opportunity for gaining additional experience. Want to get management experience? You will plan, direct, and manage camp's food service and complete additional duties as requested by the Camp Director. Provide food to campers and ensure food area is fully clean before and after food distribution. This includes but is not limited to dish and trash duties, mopping, and sweeping. Ensure safety of youth at all times by following all safety guidelines and precautions as required by the Department of Health’s policies and procedures for day camp. Ensure all required paperwork is completed from parents. Complete documentation as required by the summer food service program. Candidates must be enrolled in or seeking a career in the food/hospitality field. Minimum one year experience working in the food/hospitality field required. Experience working with youth a plus. Must be dependable and on-time. Prior to applying visit www.bgcme.org to learn more about the organization AND COMPLETE AN APPLICATION. 07746.description: BGCM Community Center & Sportsplex is seeking a hard-working, energetic, well organized, responsible person to take on the role of Athletics Director/Coordinator. Instructors will use one lesson and provide a demo lesson to Executive Director before class start date. * **Certified professionals and paraprofessionals with 60 hours of education courses are encouraged to apply. * Applicants must have previous tutoring or teaching experience, as well as the desire to help students achieve success in school and life. * Additional duties as assigned by manager. Requirements **PLEASE DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU HAVE RELATIVE EXPERIENCE IN TEACHING/TUTORING ANY GRADE FROM 3 THROUGH 12. - CANDIDATE MUST BE ABLE TO DRIVE TO LOCATION IN MARLBORO, NJ. To apply send resume, cover letter, and references to jobs@bgcme.org.

Community Center & Sportsplex, is a 501c3 nonprofit academic, arts & athletic center for youth & families founded on Christian principles, and is dedicated to instilling in each member that they have been specifically chosen by God to do magnificent things! THIS OPPORTUNITY IS TO HELP BENEFIT YOU! The Assistant may also have a huge hand in assisting with grants and development tasks and more. Responsibilities * Providing President/CEO with accurate, confidential, professionally written materials including memos, correspondence, meeting minutes, reports, agendas, manuals and handouts. * Taking ownership of President/CEO’s extremely active calendar and tasks assigned to assistant and following said tasks from inception to conclusion. * Taking initiative and being proactive, in completing tasks while often removing items from President/CEO’s to-do list and completing them. * Taking notes during every meeting or discussion in both physical and virtual meetings with President/CEO and others. * Act as site manager and assistant manager of programs and staff. * Maintaining flexibility as workloads change and participating in early morning or evening meetings as well as special events as required. * Performing special projects and other duties as assigned. Requirements * Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, and excellent computer skills. * Possess exceptional skills in presentation, interpersonal relations, and customer management. * Enrolled in a certificate or Bachelors or Masters Degree Program (preferred) in business administration, organizational leadership, psychology, public affairs, communication, or a similarly related field of study. * Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs. * Based on experience, position may start as unpaid position, with the potential to transition into a part-time or full-time paid position within the company. ALL APPLICANTS MUST: Email references and resume to chosen@bgcme.org and visit www.bgcme.org to learn more about our organization.
07746.title: IMMEDIATE OPENING: Assistant to the CEO/President – Intern or Volunteer

07509.description: CUMAC is looking for volunteers to assist our truck driver as he picks up and delivers the food, clothing and other donations that make our work possible. This role is absolutely critical to the work we do and does come with a few requirements. An assistant truck driver should be: able to lift up to 50 pounds physically able to lift and bend while loading and unloading trucks, as well as sit comfortably during trips responsible. The assistant truck driver is an extremely important role within our agency and we would need a volunteer who is reliable, timely and able to let us know in advance when they can't make it in. friendly and respectful as a representative of our agency to our donors comfortable following the directions of our truck driver (who plans the route and decides whether or not we're able to take an item) Volunteers are needed Monday-Friday from 8:30/9am until around 2:30pm. We don't expect a volunteer to work every day of the week, but would like a volunteer to be able to commit to one day a week. A long term commitment is preferable due to the training involved. We are located in downtown Paterson, just off routes 80 and 4 and we have an off street lot for you to keep your own car in while out on the road with our truck. Our typical pick up route takes us within a 10 mile radius of Paterson, but occasionally we plan longer day trips, which you would know in advance. If you are interested in this position, we would love for you to come in to meet our drivers and staff, take a tour of our programs and receive orientation. *Our assistant truck driver will not be driving vehicles and as such a valid drivers license is not required.
07509.title: Truck Driver Assistant

06855.description: This is a memorial race in memory of Ian James Eaccarino, who lost his life to drugs. Your help will be instrumental in making the race go smoothly. We will be needing people at the finish line, the starting line, and handing out water along the course at race stations.
06855.title: Ian's Race - Help us Run to Empower Youth to Be Drug Free

11701.description: PAC - Office Assistant (14 hours per week) Mon -Fri - 9:30am-1:30pm About the position: We are seeking dedicated self-starters to work with the CEO of Parent Action Community Inc.(PAC) in Amityville NY. We offer a welcoming work environment and the ability to learn and grow in a supportive atmosphere. As the office Assistant, you will be a part of having an impact on the Amityville and surrounding community with a non-profit organization. About Parent Action Community: Parent Action Community (PAC) was established in 2005 by parents concerned with the behavior and condition of today's youth. We are a fully-accredited 501(c) (3) charity equipping young adults for the responsibility of leadership. PAC’s goals are to Equip, Empower, and Educate \"At-Risk\" Youth And Young Adults between the ages of 13 and 24. We develop their Knowledge, Personal Skills, and Motivation to Reduce Adolescent Pregnancies, High School Dropout Rates, Sexually Transmitted Diseases, including HIV/AIDS, Substance Abuse, Juvenile Delinquencies, and Reduction In Crimes through a Comprehensive, Community-Wide Collaborative Effort to Improve Academic Achievement in order to be Career and College-prepared. Our Volunteers have a unique opportunity to gain valuable campaigning and nonprofit experience, cultivate your interests in social equality, strengthen your understanding of a fast-paced campaign organization, and gain critical organization skills and experience. PAC’s reputation of providing services to the Amityville and surrounding community has grown over the last 10 years. We are looking to expand the organization and programs in the future. The role of Office assistant is to support the organization by overseeing the office during High School Diploma program, the distribution center and the tutoring programs. The Office Assistant will be responsible for the following: Preparing weekly reports on the activities in the PAC center during their volunteer hours. Ensure that all visitors sign in and complete a PAC \"in-need\" form. Prepare a weekly report on visitors. Prepare a weekly report on items that PAC was unable to supply. Preparing weekly reports on volunteer hours. Track number of program recipients. Provide a weekly report on attendance Prepare a monthly report for the CEO Review all Outgoing correspondences Qualifications: * Demonstrated commitment to Youth and Community projects; * Excellent written and verbal communication skills; * Good organizational skills, attention to detail, professional demeanor and the ability to juggle several tasks while meeting deadlines; * Experience or interest in non-profits an advantage;
11701.title: Volunteer Office Assistant

11701.description: Position name: ESL Tutor Sundays 3-6pm Parent Action Community Inc. is looking for ESL Volunteer to provide classroom and administrative support in our Youth/Adult Basic Education program. No experience is required. This position offers the opportunity to teach all levels of ESL, and provide administrative support to our office management. Main duties: * Teaching Weekly English lessons to youth and adults of other Language (All levels) and developing lesson plans and assessing learning progress of program participants * Evaluate and report progress in English proficiency of ESL participants * Tutoring High School Equivalency Program participants with their English homework for Advanced ESL Participants * Supporting office staff with ESL-related tasks, eg: translating for participants, English documents and website to other languages. * Assist with community outreach activities as needed Preferred: ESL Certified Instructor but not required Website: www.pac4success.org
11701.title: ESL Volunteer Tutor

10523.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10523.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Greenburgh Multiplex in Elmsford, NY!

11743.description: Do you want to educate, motivate and have a blast all while volunteering to promote healthy living and well-being? There is an opportunity waiting for your encouraging voice and energetic personality. You would get the chance to offer your services of Yoga, Tai chi, Pilate's, Floor Exercise Routines, Nutrition Information or Aromatherapy for those living with mental illness or substance abuse issues. This is a great opportunity to teach those who suffer from substance abuse, other coping mechanisms and ways to reduce stress naturally. It is also a great way to build experience in your field.
11743.title: Health and Wellness Professional Volunteer

11743.description: We are looking for dedicated volunteers with excellent customer service skills to perform follow up phone calls for our patients after they leave the hospital. In this role, you would work closely with the health care team and connect with people at a vulnerable time in their life to ensure that their discharge needs are being addressed. We are seeking compassionate, well spoken individuals who love people, are at least 20 years of age and able to donate 3-4 hours weekly.
11743.title: Patient Outreach Volunteer

OPEN TIME DAYS There are four 3 hour shifts each day, Monday through Friday; however, you don’t have to be available during the full hours, unless we are trying to meet a deadline. Shifts needed now are 9 to noon and/or noon to 3. REQUIRED TRAINING Disaster Cycle Services: An Overview Recovery Services: An Overview Direct Client Assistance Fundamentals Casework & Recovery Planning Fundamentals Meet the Client: What is a Family? 08540.description: The volunteer experience at Good Grief is life changing. The children and families teach our facilitators a great deal about life, resiliency, hope, and the need for supporting each other. Many volunteers say they receive much more than they give. This meaningful experience not only impacts the children of Good Grief, but most facilitators attest to the ways in which this experience has drastically changed and improved their lives, as this work is both personally transformative and rewarding. #CHC
08540.title: Become a peer-support group facilitator for grieving children!

08540.description: arketing, Social Medial Summer/Fall/ Winter/Spring Internships The DoughMain Education Foundation was created to teach children basic financial and economic literacy skills to promote life-long financial health. The Foundation works closely with educators, opinion makers, business leaders and families to dramatically improve financial literacy and better prepare the next generation for a lifetime of good financial decisions. DMEF creates and makes available free lessons, activities, and assessments of the highest quality to schools and teachers. We are currently developing a student-centered financial literacy program that is standards-based and provides 60 hours for high school students. The DoughMain Education Foundation offers unpaid internships to current students and recent graduates interested in learning the inner workings of a nonprofit organization. Interns will be paired with a Foundation team member for one-on-one mentorship to gain hands-on experience in their area of interest. Requirements Applicants must: * Be available to work 15-20 hours per week during regular business hours at DoughMain Education Foundation HQ Princeton, New Jersey. * Have excellent verbal and written communication skills and a high level of computer competency. * Be self-motivated, organized, willing to help with any project no matter how large or small, and be able to balance multiple priorities at once. * Have a strong desire to make a difference, a passion for the DoughMain Education Foundation mission, a positive attitude, and a sense of humor. Application Process If you meet all of the above requirements and would like to be considered for an internship, please send a cover letter and resume and put INTERNSHIP and Focus Area in the subject line. Marketing and Social Media: Social media- Twitter, LinkeIn, Facebook, Pinterist, newsletter and editorial tasks as well as project management, including project initiation, working with the internal creative team stewarding the review and approval process, Updating promotional items, supporting active events, outreach etc. Use of Constant Contact, Hoot Suite schedulers and analytics.
08540.title: Marketing Social Media Internship

Remove annuals. Cut back perennials. Store signs and decorations in the shed.

10118.description: Do good for your community while using your professional expertise. Work with talented peers on a rewarding non-profit cause related program. The Rare Genomics Institute is making a difference. RG is a nonprofit organization that helps families in need of genome research. The Human Resources Generalist will provide HR support related to staff trainings, webinars, special staff events, and culture building. Position Responsibilities: Trainings: Develop, plan, and manage training programs and services Coordinate staff professional development program Develop new training initiatives and implement skills enhancement programs Events: Plan staff outings and events and manage the planning,communications, execution and follow-up strategies for each event Foster team-wide culture through all-staff gatherings Create events that broaden staff engagement Recommends employee relations practices necessary to establish a positive employer-employee relationship and promote a high level of employee morale and motivation Qualifications: Bachelor's degree with a concentration in Human Resources or other related field of study is preferred. Three to five years of experience required. Strong administrative skills with excellent organization and attention to detail Possesses strong interpersonal skills Other duties as assigned by the Human Resources staff
10118.title: Human Resources (Culture Building /Employee Engagement)

We are looking for FIVE CHEFS to donate ONE HOUR In which you will share: (1) Brief history of how you became a chef (2) One cool kitchen tip or skill (3) Teach one simple recipe In exchange: We promise you will have an amazing time You will be featured as one of our partners in all our social media outlets, press releases, and communications. 07512.description: Looking for volunteers who love children and cooking! 11377.description: Title : Event Volunteer Reports to : Volunteer Coordinator DESCRIPTION OF PROJECT / PURPOSE OF ASSIGNMENT: Woodside on the Move is hosting it's annual festival, te festival celebrates the various cultures that make up the body of Woodside's Community. TIME COMMITMENT: Event day volunteers will typically be asked to commit at least 4 hours. Participation on an event planning committee typically requires larger time commitments over several months. QUALIFICATIONS NEEDED: Qualifications vary, depending on specific tasks/events BENEFITS: Volunteers will be part of the decision-making body of a neighborhood organization that has been providing after school and affordable housing for four decades, which support critical programs that are LIFELINES for Queens’ families. Depending on the type of event, volunteers may be able to attend the event free of charge or at a reduced price. All WOTM volunteers receive the WOTM’s newsletter and receive recognition on WOTM’s social media handles and on our published works . Event volunteers also have the opportunity to learn skills from professionals, while fostering healthy community engagement. For all inquiries, please send resume and brief cover letter via email. 11372.description: We are in immediate need to form a small brigade of volunteers to practice \"mock interviews\" with adult students who will take the citizenship exam in the coming months: July - September 2017. About the opportunity: Volunteer Citizenship Coaches provide one-on-one practice and support for Spanish-speaking immigrants seeking to pass their naturalization exams. Volunteers conduct \"mock interviews\" with students which simulate the actual naturalization interview, and provide feedback to students following each \"mock interview\" to help reinforce students' progress. Students who passed the exams, have constantly reported that the volunteer's feedback was crucial to passing their citizenship exams and obtaining U.S. Citizenship. Shifts: Volunteers can take one shift or more per week that lasts approximately 2.5 hours every Saturday. We are looking for dedicated volunteers who can start volunteering from the third Saturday of July through the end of September with the possibility of continuing on for our late Fall class cycle. Wherever fitting, volunteers may also continue volunteering for the following cycle of classes. Location: Jackson Heights, Queens About the MRNY Environment: Make the Road New York offers a dynamic and supportive environment where community members connect with each other, with staff and volunteers to find support about issues affecting the immigrant community. MRNY's Mission: Make the Road New York (MRNY) builds the power of Latino and working class communities to achieve dignity and justice through organizing, policy innovation, transformative education, and survival services.
11372.title: A Brigade of Civic Volunteers- Provide Citizenship Training to Latino Immigrants

06880.description: CAG is seeking an individual to serve as a Board member who has background in strategic marketing, which ideally includes a blend of marketing planning and execution, with direct experience at an advertising agency or on the client side, with branding, advertising and communications experience. Advocacy experience is also highly regarded. CAG desires assistance to expand its reach, awareness and membership statewide - including further penetration into underserved communities. Also important will be cultivating and maintaining relationships with funders, members, collaborating organizations and legislators as well as the ability to work at a quick pace, flexibly and nimbly. Excellent written and verbal skills are a must. Responsibilities to include the following: Collaborating with the Executive Director and Board leadership to develop and execute a comprehensive marketing and communications plan employing strategies that will broaden programmatic reach and deepen impact, including hands-on experience with all appropriate aspects of social media Managing the ongoing promotion of major programs and developing and executing messaging for new initiatives Identifying and crafting stories that communicate the essence of the organization’s mission and successes Working with the technology-development team to identify a set of meaningful touchpoints with our targets - new member joining, annual pledging - and creating an array of appropriate communications to be automated and sent, in order to stay current and ensure maximum engagement and support from our stakeholders. Working with all CAG committees, specifically including Development and Programming, to assist with execution of their annual plans and to help further corporate engagement efforts Identifying significant media and public policy issues that can be leveraged to support CAG’s work, and creating and implementing plans to exploit them

11801.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .

11201.description: Hello! We are A Free Bird, a 501 (c) 3 non profit organization dedicated to inspiring and nourishing children with cancer through the arts! We have children who are in remission from cancer or still fighting cancer who are dreaming to learn more about different art forms. We are currently seeking Amazing Talented Tutors who are able to teach our AFB children an art form once a week for an hour. The program lasts for 12 weeks, so must have a commitment time of minimum 12 weeks. The children are either in patient or out patient depending upon the child and where they are at now. If you would like more information please log on to our website: www.afreebird.org There you will find info about our 3 Programs, DREAM, FIGHT FREE, FREE. Come find out why being a tutor for AFB is such a rewarding experience! We look forward to meeting you and cannot wait to have you get started! Please email all resumes to: Programs@afreebird.org

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. The GoodS is a segment-based talk show starring Godni Amir & Sarah Coursey. We discuss the arts, culture, health, sustainability, and more! Responsibilities: Combine elements of color and texture to provide a visual understanding of the director’s view, characters associated, age, social status, etc. Will be helping with children and understanding if there is a play, what costume needs to be worn. Must learn about the personalities of the characters and when the production will be set in time. Suggest relationships between characters.

11201.description: Job Description: Overseeing entire operations of the Fundraising Department. Continuing to keep the mission of the organization alive and fully support every aspect of the organization/company. Ability to manage a staff of 1-20 depending upon positions available. Continuing job description of Fundraising Coordinator, overseeing entire operations for Fundraising Department, including but not limiting to managing volunteers/interns, Fundraising Coordinator, etc. Responsibilities: - Manage, provide guidance to, and ensure accountability of AFB fundraising staff. - Ensure that the fundraising staff has clear and achievable objectives. - The resources and institutional support needed to carry out responsibilities; and positive and effective relationships with internal and external donors/sponsors and with counterparts in AFB - Develop a sound, achievable, comprehensive fundraising strategy to meet the goals for unrestricted and private restricted fundraising set by the President. Lead and coordinate the fundraising staff team to implement the plan efficiently and effectively. - Ensure that the fundraising strategy of AFB is adequately diversified and includes tactics in specific areas such as major donors, web based giving, foundations, corporate support, etc. - Collaborate with staff across the organization in order to ensure consistency in representing AFB to potential donors and other audiences. - Must continue support of AFB Mission and its goals. - Extending role of Fundraising Coordinator. - Must provide oversight of entire Fundraising Department, including but not limited to, interns/volunteers in any position, Fundraising Coordinator, Fundraising Budget Manager, Fundraising Material Specialist, etc. - Will Coordinate to expand and diversify AFB’s donor base, working closely with other volunteers/interns to secure proper funding. - Submitting Weekly, Monthly, Yearly goals and how the goals will be executed for the Fundraising Department. Competencies: - 2-4 year degree in Finance, Financial Accounting, Financial Management, Business Management, or 3-5 years experience in related field. - Proven record of continued/extensive team leadership skills. Ability to manage 1-20 employees. - Being able to work independently and also be a self motivated person. - Excellent Verbal and Written skills is required.
11201.title: VP of Marketing

11201.description: A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply: please send your CV along a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.
11201.title: Director of Development

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501 (c) 3 non profit organization dedicated to inspiring and nourishing children with cancer through the therapeutic form of the arts. A Free Bird helps children ages 4-18 achieve their DREAM and inspires them to continue with their passion for the arts! We are currently seeking an Experienced HR Associate for Nonprofits, someone who is experienced with HR related work and has a minimum of 4 months on their schedule to be available. Someone who has worked in the non profit world perferred but not required. This is a time when someone who is taking a leave from one job and wants to do something in their spare time, or has the experience and is not able to receive a job for right now. Anyone who is willing to be part of this position will work 10-15 hours per week and will be in charge of minimum 30 volunteers for events, daily tasks/assignments, and hiring new volunteers and interns. The organization is growing and we are excited to bring on new and incredible talent that can really help us get to the next level. If you are someone who is available to 10-15 hours per week Tues-Thurs has a passion to help children with cancer, knows the Human Resources Field, is computer savvy, is patient, and gets along with people, then WE WANT YOU! Come help us fight cancer through the arts and empowering every child to become FREE from their disease! Please apply with a RESUME to HR@afreebird.org

11201.description: Performing Arts Performing arts is unique in that what the artist performs may be solo or within a group. Therefore, you may be required to continuously be in contact with individuals with whom the artists collaborates with and their respective managers. Ideal Candidate Visual This position specifically entails assisting artists in creating a portfolio that accurately represents their talents as a visual artist. The manager for those interested in visual artists Ideal Candidate Print You will develop an expertise in the publishing industry. You will furthermore work with the artist to determine what outlet the artist would like to use to express their passion to write. Regardless of what area of writing the artist is pursuing, may it be journalism or writing a book, an critical part of this position is understanding how to keep the artist on a content-driven track. Ideal Candidate · Experience in print and digital media · Skills in online marketing · Professional or academic exposure to creative writing Multimedia It is imperative that the multimedia artist manager not only have an essential understanding of multimedia arts, but also being willing to expand this interpretation based on a given artist’s passions. Ideal Candidate · Experience working in the multimedia industry · Flexible attitude toward mediums used for artist expression Styling Arts This position is unique in that artists use the human body as their medium of expression. Therefore, there will always be another person or other people involved in the Artist Management Process. Ideal Candidate · Expertise in communication skills · Experience in the styling industry (hair, makeup, fashion, etc)

11201.description: ***Serious inquiries only, please only respond with a resume and an interest of 6 months or more, anyone who does not meet the following requirements will not be accepted for this volunteer opportunity.*** A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life-threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans, and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theater, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net-worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply: please send your CV along with a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.
11201.title: Volunteer Director of Development

This CPA must be available at most 6 hours per week, majority of work is done through out interns but we want to make sure they are also receiving a learning experience and continuing to follow NYS guidelines and regulations for the organization. The CPA will be offering financial advice, audit accounts and provide info about the financial records. Reviewing the information and relating back to interns/volunteers. We would like a better understanding of the accounting procedures of the organization and be able to work with you outside of that as well.

11207.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor .

10027.description: Summer Quest’s mission is to ignite intellectual curiosity, prepare students for competitive exams and to cultivate academic development through a variety of inquiry and project-based enrichment classes throughout the summer. Our goal is to offer rising 6 th, 7 th, 8 th and 9 th graders a competitive advantage for the upcoming school year. Our Summer Program is looking for a Lifeguard with prior pool experience and the ability to work for one event in the summer. The ideal candidate will have excellent skills in the water and prior experience working with children. Program Description: Date/Time: Friday, July 28 th, 10:30AM-3:30PM Location: Riverbank State Park Pool 679 Riverside Dr, New York, NY 10031 Summer Quest Lifeguard Summary: We will have 145 students ages 10-13 at the pool for five hours on Friday, July 28 th. We need six lifeguards to supervise the event to make sure that everyone has fun in a safe way. Lifeguards will be required to monitor pool-related activities closely and identify any safety issues, direct swimmers out of the pool in hazardous conditions and monitor weather to ensure safety of children. Job Requirements: Documents showing that you have passed the NYC Lifeguard Qualifying Test First Aid and CPR certifications Ability to pass pre-employment practical skills test in the water 2+ years’ lifeguard experience preferred To apply: Fax or email cover letter, resume and three references to: Harlem Educational Activities Fund 2090 Seventh Ave, 10 th Floor New York, NY 10027 Attn: Summer Quest Teacher search Fax: (212) 663-9736 Email: cgriffith@heaf.org
10027.title: Summer Quest Life Guard

11208.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11208.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Linden Blvd Multiplex in Brooklyn, NY!

11105.description: Situated on a 260-acre campus in New Jersey, Collier High School offers a specialized educational opportunity for about 150 students. Students come to Collier having had difficulty adapting to public schools due to emotional or psychological difficulties such as depression, anxiety, or behavioral issues. Good Shepherd Volunteers fill many roles at this school. Options include, but are not limited to, teaching, tutoring, running sports/extracurricular groups, facilitating arts/theater/music events, youth counseling, curriculum development, administration assistance, and ropes course instruction. You are encouraged to use your unique gifts, talents, and passions to choose which way to best serve students while also allowing yourself to try new things and help in various settings.
11105.title: Full-time volunteer with Collier Youth High School

11105.description: Good Shepherd Volunteers is a one-year full-time volunteer program that serves women, children, and adolescents affected by poverty, violence and neglect. The upcoming volunteer year starts August 2017 and ends approximately July 2018. Our volunteers live in community with each other, have a small living stipend, and practice the 4 Tenets of GSV: social justice, community, spirituality, and simplicity. We need people who are compassionate, flexible, and are up for a challenge. The populations we are working with are usually in a traumatic moment in their lives. We have placements in group homes, working with youth in and coming out of foster homes, a domestic violence shelter, in school settings, and in public policy. We invite you to learn more about our program by visiting our website at www.gsvolunteers.org!
11105.title: Full-Time Volunteer Opportunities with Good Shepherd Volunteers

11361.description: About Are you interested in a field that works closely with individuals who have intellectual and developmental disabilities? Would you like to share your interests with someone who enjoys it just as much as you? Partners Health Plan, a not for profit health plan that supports the lives of individuals with developmental and intellectual disabilities, is looking for volunteers for The PAL Program. The PAL Program discovers a member’s passion, interests, and matches up the individual with a person or place in the community sharing a similar passion or interest. We discover what you enjoy and how it could potentially match with a member of PHP. Member Information 28 year old female who would like someone to take the subways with and travel to museums, art classes, libraries, and science centers. She has a mild form of autism, and is very interested in art, science, and furthering her education. How does it work? Meet with individual preferably once a week or depending on schedule flexibility Meet at home and travel to and from Bayside area with individual First outing will always be accompanied by Community Resource Coordinator Provide your own transportation to meet the individual at the destination Report to community resource coordinator with updates on the progress of outings Form natural friendship with individual based on similar interests Benefits Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of program Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers Hours: Approximately one a week depending on the activity and volunteer schedule Suggested Commitment: 6 months - 1 year PHP provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.

07950.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments.
