Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07950.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike!

10703.description: Communicate Knowledge INC is 501(c)3 non for profit organization whose aim is to democratize access to science. We provide world’s leading classes on Robotics, Math, Big Data and 3D design for children and college students. Our classes are designed in an intuitive way of teaching Digital and Applied science. We strive to teach kids how to create and solve math problems in no failure way, make Robotics/3D easy to construct and exploit, organize team work, and sharpen leadership skills. Dates: July 10th - September 1, 2017 Scheduled Dates: 8.45 am-6.00 pm every day 5 days a week with shifts availability. Evening or weekend training for additional 2 hours will be provided for two or three weeks during the camp time and will be scheduled according to the personal preferences of the employees. All our staff with our students help out with games and camp events and serve as teachers/mentors/counselors. Please, be aware, that we strive to create and promote an atmosphere of the safe, coherent and careful place to stay and learn for our children, and employees/volunteers, and we must take measures to fulfill it. REQUIREMENTS AND WORK DESCRIPTION Teachers/Counselors/Volunteers are expected to: - teach and/or organize, interact, assist with the teamwork of 8-14 students in classes and during the breaks; - teach according to daily lessons curriculum, provide instructional support and use our creativity tools to create their own tasks if they feel confident and capable; - follow up the strategies that were proposed or develop their own that can be implemented when got approved by the leadership of Communicate Knowledge INC. - Provide feedback to students’ parents after the day stay, - be agile in various methods of engaging students into a teamwork and make recommendations for students as they move through the program. - Do you best to think and generate new and better ways to do things, drawing on what they've seen, read, and experienced, who replace \"I can't do that\" with \"Let's make it happen!\". - look for the opportunities and foster students with a passion for entrepreneurship who might be capable of helping lead their startups with an additional compensation of any positive initiatives proposed and executed. According to personal circumstances some compensations could be provided. APPLY HERE https://docs.google.com/a/knsacademy.org/forms/d/114bvTtXAobdXfl0DgYJIvjkH-sbuN5UNH4rD3WQ0mpM/prefill?pli=1 or email to: knowledgeexcels@gmail.com
10703.title: Intern, teacher or volunteer in Robotics, Math, Big Data, 3D classes

10701.description: Volunteers should expect to work with several children during each 2 hour session. The children will have selected a book and then be matched up with a volunteer. After introductions the \"buddies\" will find a spot where they can work together for 20 minutes. The volunteer will encourage the student to read, help with specific words, pronunciation and comprehension. When they’ve finished the book the volunteer will help the child complete a worksheet. We give out \"passports\" to every child who registers for Summer Reading Buddies and each child gets a stamp on his passport for each day they attend. The volunteer will then bring the child back to our staff who will match them up with their next \"buddy\". Summer Reading Buddies volunteer opportunties are also available at the Mt Vernon Public Library and the Ossining Public Library. Please contact us for further information. Everyone enjoys this program. Take a look at coverage by WPIX 11: http://www.jcy-wcp.com/summermediacraze.html
10701.title: Summer Reading Buddies

10701.description: Mentor wil develop supportive, consistent mentoring relationship with a child through recreational play and paraprofessional therapeutic techniques. Help children explore and cope with social and/or family struggles. The Reach & Rise program has changes the lives of many young people in Yonkers. We want to continue that trend, but we can not do it without your help. Come and bring a revolutionary change to Yonkers youth and become a mentor today.
10701.title: Volunteer Mentor

10704.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at theaters in MA, RI, CT, NJ, NY and OH. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
10704.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at Cross County Multiplex in Yonkers, NY!

11212.description: Project YOU, Formally known as, NYC Community Services is hosting our third annual, \"Lunch For Friends,\" on Monday July 4, 2017 from 11:00 AM -2:00 PM, at The Women in Need Facility located at: Junius and Liberty Shelter, 51/25 Junius Street, Brooklyn NY, to help give the families of our community who are in need a chance to celebrate Independence Day like millions of other families will We need volunteers and as many helping hands as possible From 9:30 am (for set up) - 3PM (for clean up) Please come out and help support a great cause!!! We especially need face painters, singers, arts and crafts instructors for the children so please share and email us your talents! We are also seeking a volunteer coordinator to help out with the event. I need the help! If available to volunteer please email us. We are getting shirts for all of the volunteers at this event and would need your sizes ahead of time. Food and drinks will be available for all volunteers. Please email Anne Marie annemarie@projectyouny.org or call 718-382-4424 ext. 114 Event Information: Location: 25 Junius Street Date:Monday, July 4 th 2017 Volunteer needed from: 10:00 AM - 3:45 (Flexible with different shifts) Event Starts: 11:00 AM - 3:00 PM Contact person: Anne Marie Grillasca annemarie@projectyouny.org or 718-382-4424 press coverage of last year's event https://projectyouny2016.wixsite.com/mysite https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ex5GRXKyE-A More about the event While most will be thinking of fireworks, and barbecues in celebration of our National Holiday, we want to focus our attention on those who may not have a warm meal. We will be serving free hot meals, snacks, and drinks to all those in need. In addition, we will be offering fun activities to engage the younger members of our community. Over a million New Yorkers will not be able to celebrate this 4th of July due to hunger and poverty. Help us bring light to the issue of hunger in our local community, which is not only a community issue, but a long standing issue within our society. So far, Project You \"Lunch For Friends\", is expecting over 1000 attendants from the local Women in Need Shelters in the Brooklyn area, as well as, other local community members and political leaders to speak. We thank you for your support. If your unable to attend the event and would like to make a donation please contact us at 718-382-4424 or at our website www.projectyouny.org
11212.title: Independence Day "Lunch for Friends" BBQ (July 4 2017) Volunteers Needed

11213.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor .
11213.title: Volunteer Information Session
11213.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Join us for this exciting opportuntiy to create a brand new league for youth who need it in Crown Heights! Yes, you can empower youth and their families to get active in a neighborhood without many options. Help us build the first-ever youth Crown Heights Soccer League! Seeking anyone who can play soccer or support the program from July through December. Saturdays and Sundays, and possibly Thursday evenings. We are thinking to do a few sessions in JULY if volunteers step up. Have a few spare hours on the weekend or even Thursday eves? Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Yes, high school students are welcome and we give community service credits. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to build a league. Kids love it, but don't know the game. Help us create teams! We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. SCHEDULE - July (if possible) - tell us any dates you can do these hours in July FALL: Sept. 9 - Thanksgiving! THURSDAYS, 5 - 7 pm SATURDAYS, 1 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 4 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 11 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If youi're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. WE ASK VOLUNTEERS TO COMMIT TO AT LEAST 2 TIMES ON THE FIELD. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas for Crown Heights Fest - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your backgrounds so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - Here's our pages: SEEDS IN THE MIDDLE BROOKLYN-CROWN HEIGHTS SOCCER Soccer for Harmony
11213.title: Soccer Players!  Share joy of game, help NEW league for underserved kids!

11213.description: LOVE TO GARDEN AND WANT TO SHARE THAT PASSION AND SKILL WITH KIDS? We have schools and teachers who want gardens and need help either during the school day... and help to maintain them over the summer months. These children live in food deserts and growing food is a way to ensure they get to eat fresh! If you can share your knowledge of gardening or environmenal education with eager students in Brownsville, BK, Crown Heights or Flatbush, contact us. Even two hours a week is helpful. Give us your schedule. But we are most looking for right now is: GARDENING TIMES Mondays - 8:30 - 12:30 Thursdays - 8:30 am - 2 pm If you have other times or can only do a few hours in these time slots, let us know. Also - HIP2B HEALTHY MARKETS if you want to help us run Hip2B Healthy Markets, where kids sell healthy snacks at school, please let us know. They usually run early morning before 8:30 am or 2-4 pm. KIds can sell their plants at the market, along with fun, fresh snacks like bags of strawberries, etc. Everything is 50 cents. WHAT TO DO - SEND RESUME OR BIO TO INFO@SEEDSINTHEMIDDLE.ORG and tell us what you want to do and what skills you have, and times you can commit YOU DON'T HAVE TO BE A SKILLED GARDENER - JUST LIKE TO HELP KIDS, AND LEARN WITH US. We're also creating a widespread healthy food box program in central Brooklyn. If you'd like to help farm or distribute or do anything related to this, let us know. We welcome healthy cooking demos, also. We need folks interested in education, nutrition, cooking, growing and more, or just want to do something good to address health and food disparities hurting underserved kids! All skills welcome. Just be reliable and a self-starter. Please send us a resume or tell us something about yourself. We are excited to hear from you. Tell us what you'd like to do and what experience you have and why you want to help. Send to info@seedsinthemiddle.org. We take all time commiments. Just make sure you commit to only what you can do! Yes, we do internships and community service letters. .
11213.title: Garden? Want to work with kids? Share green joy in Brooklyn

Smorgasburg is an annual food festival. We are looking for volunteers to help us guarantee that all food waste ends up in the appropriate bins. This will require some interaction with event goers and kitchen staff.
11211.title: Support Composting Efforts in Brooklyn!

11217.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. After a very incredible and successful year and in order to help as many kids as possible, we are seeking a Public Relations Coordinator/Manager volunteer who can commit 15-20 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months(150 hours). Responsibilities: Working with a small team, conceptualize and implement traditional and social media strategies and campaigns aimed at generating coverage of AFB's programs, key advocacy issues and marketing and celebrity-driven campaigns. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Produce blogs and other content for external publication. Edit commentaries produced by other AFB staff. Coach and supervise PR Intern Assistants. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Expand and nurture AFB's mainstream and social media network. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Build and manage our Twitter-sphere. In Collaboration with our Social Media Director and Marketing Coordinator Help manage the AFB's media database, build lists and track media coverage. Qualifications: Excellent writing and editing skills with ability to produce polished and compelling copy on tight deadlines Creativity in tapping and cultivating mainstream media and social networking communities Keen insight into the news business and understanding of what makes journalists tick Proven ability to identify and market good story ideas Prefer candidate with local or hyperlocal media relationships A positive, energetic and proactive multi-tasker who can work independently or very collaboratively, as part of a team Ability to work effectively, efficiently, diplomatically and calmly in a high-pressure environment on issues that are often complex and politically sensitive Strong listener, with a high degree of professionalism and flexibility, including the ability to prioritize and effectively manage assignments in a timely fashion
11217.title: PR Social Media Coordinator

11217.description: The member will support the IT team at Brooklyn Community Services, which provides computer support to 25 sites across Brooklyn. Goals: Respond to staff requests 20% faster. What you will learn: The member will have the opportunity to develop valuable skills in staff communications and IT within a non-profit context. Responsibilities: Provide direct technical support Support BCS staff by maintaining current hardware and continually upgrading all hardware and software Set up equipment for meetings and conferences Generate new hire e-mail addresses, as needed Other ad hoc duties as assigned by the IT Manager, IT Technician, and Senior IT Technician
11217.title: IT (Information Technology) Volunteer

11217.description: Looking for a fun experience this summer? Help be an usher, front of house or assistant director for our theatre shows. Great for early education majors, or theatre majors. Several days per week, flexible schedule. Nice staff and fun opportunity. Mostly mornings through 2pm. Meet lots of fun people. Very people oriented opportunity. Please email your resume along with a few sentences explaining your interest in this internship.
11217.title: College Interns

11217.description: We are currently seeking 1-2 people to help us out with the following for our Parents support group of children being affected by cancer: 1. Assist with securing new Support Group sponsors 2. Communicate with vendors to secure deliverables, gift certificates and logos to properly thank them on social media 3. Attend support group events to establish a relationship with parents and care takers to improve retention of participants. 4. Assist with securing meeting and or event space. 5. Keep a running list of attendees to inform them of upcoming activities.
11217.title: Administration Volunteer

11217.description: A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theatre, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success. To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply : please send your CV along a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.
11217.title: Development Director

11214.description: 2017 Special Needs Summer Program runs every Sundays from 7/9 - 8/27 from 3pm-4:30pm. Looking for a creative arts therapist (music or art therapist) to help out during our summer program. We have about 5 kids with ASD. The Volunteer does not have to stay the entire time but at least 30 mins to provide activities to interact with the kids. This is a great experience for current graduate student, just graduated, or experienced therapist.
11214.title: Creative Arts Therapist

11215.description: We need your help to make our 2017 New York Lymphoma Walk a success! Volunteers are needed from 6:30am - 12:30pm on Sunday, July 9, 2017 at the Nethermead in Prospect Park. Volunteers are needed for the following areas: set-up t-shirt distribution registration food prep and distribution general clean-up Since 2003, the Lymphoma Research Founation (LRF) has raised over $20 million through its nationwide Active Lifestyle Events Program. The Lymphoma Walk is a non-competitive 5k walk where survivors, family, friends, community and corporate teams walk in honor and in memory of those whose lives have been touched by lymphoma. Funds raised by participants will supoort LRF's mission of eradicating lymphoma and serving those touched by this disease. **Event will happen rain or shine
11215.title: Volunteers Needed- 5k Walk in Prospect Park, Brooklyn

11215.description: Fitness challenge fundraiser- Board members of Mae's Breath Foundation will take part in basic fitness challenges: Push-ups/ Sit-ups/ etc., As they promote lung cancer and lung wellness. Members will seek sponsorship prior to date and meet the goals of the challenge. We're seeking volunteers to assist us on the day of event in: -Need- someone to film/ video event -Need-all volunteers to help in handing out snacks and drinks -Need- all volunteers to alert passer byes of the activities and hand out postcards to those who are interested in the organization. Also they should be prepared to take email details for those who would like further information to future events/ activities. -Need-a volunteer to help post to social media. -Need- a volunteer to monitor and time the event fitness challenge. 4-5 people will suffice Each volunteer will be supplied a tee-shirt representing foundation.
11215.title: MB Fitness Challenge

10035.description: We are currently accepting applications for Volunteer Dance Teachers for our Summer Program at Groove With Me, Inc. Groove With Me is a free dance school for girls in East Harlem. It engages girls during the idle out-of-school hours when 90% of youth violence occurs; and seeks to decrease teen pregnancy, truancy, crime, violence, prostitution, substance abuse and gang related activity. East Harlem has the highest unmet need for after school programming of any neighborhood in NYC. By volunteering you provide much needed out-of-school time safety - and arts programming. Summer Programming 2017 Schedule: Session 1 will run from July 5th - August 1st (4 weeks) Session 2 will run from August 2- August 22nd (3 weeks) If you are interested in this opportunity, please give me a call at 212-987-5910 or reach me via email at beatriz@groovewithme.org Beatriz Coronel, MA Program Director Groove With Me, Inc. 186 E 123rd St NY, NY 10035 Phone: 212-987-5910 Fax: 212-987-5080 www.groovewithme.org
10035.title: Volunteer Dance Teachers Needed for our Summer Program at Groove With Me, Inc.

10037.description: We are seeking enthusiastic, creative, industrious, responsible, punctual, and best of all, creative people who can generate fun every moment of the summer day camp experience. Depending upon your experience, you will work as Teacher, Head Counselor, or Group Leader in the classroom, in offsite locations, or in the gymnasium/outdoor playground. Must have tons of energy, a willingness to make a fool of yourself for the sake of making someone smile, the ability to give \"warm fuzzies\" on a daily basis, and a desire to have FUN! If you have experience in any of the following, this camp is for you: visual art, music, dramatic art, wacky science, coding, maker faire, financial literacy, entrepreneurship, community service, activism, literacy, education, chess, juggling, sports, yoga, firethrowing, marching band, drill team, gardening, cooking, learning, sharing love with children.
10037.title: Sunny Faces Welcome! Looking For Summer Camp Counselors - NYC

10037.description: We're looking for CodeSters who have the ability, fluidity, and patience to work with students between the ages of 6-16 with instruction on app development, website development, robotics, or game development. You will be on the cutting edge of teaching computer science concepts, as less than 10% of New York City, as well as US schools have a computer science curriculum. You will utilize the existing creativity that already exists within the spirits of children, as well as their knack for apps and video games, and channel this energy into supporting them in learning wireframing, weibsite, app & game development. If you are into Scratch, Arduino, JAVA, or HTML, this is a PLUS. Come contribute your mastery to increase the interest in STEM in our students one of our Harlem locations!
10037.title: Teach Kids How To Code: Join Our Summer STEM Program In Harlem!

10031.description: Urban Scholars is looking for support for their College Readiness class at the City College of New York on Wednesdays and Thursdays from July 5th - July 20th. The class runs from 1:45 pm - 3:00 pm. Volunteers would lead a class of high school students on different skills needed to suceed in college. This would include preparing their college application, choosing the right college to go to, how to manage their study time for college, how to take notes in class, and how to read dense academic material. 1. Engaging public speaker/presenter 2. Great rapport with high school students. 3. Skill with power point or other presentation tools like Prezi. 4. Willingness to do the necessary research to build workshops from the ground up on subject that will guide students for the college preparation process. I have a list that I could give them. 5. The person will have to co-ordinate with with other members so they don't do the same things. Learn more about Urban Scholars here: https://www.ccny.cuny.edu/gca/urban-scholars
10031.title: Urban Scholars Looking for College Readiness Instructor

10031.description: Google CS First Guru The Boys and Girls Club of Harlem is committed to providing access and opportunity fo r students throughout the area to reach their full potential. The Boys and Girls Club reaches students at 5 sites across Harlem. O ur mission for the CS program is to introduce kids to STEM programs at a young age . This is designed to peak an interest so students will one day enter the career field of STEM. Volunteers are crucial to the advancement of these goals. We appreciate every volunteer who comes through our door s and provide you the best skills to succeed with the organization. Should the full 2 hours work for you our sessions are 1 hour blocks. We would love to have you for just 1 hour in that window. CS first volunteer BGC Harlem is seeking a dedicated individual to teach a computer science program to students during the summer We will provide all training necessary to make sure you are confident with your skills before placing you in the classroom We understand you may have a very busy schedule, however, we would ask for 2 hours a day 1-2 days per week. College and high school students looking for volunteer hours are strongly encouraged to apply.
10031.title: Google CS First Guru

10031.title: Playing on the Edge Basketball Program Inc.

07738.description: Volunteer for iCan Bike, a program that teaches individuals with disabilities to independently ride a conventional two wheel bicycle over the course of five days. Volunteers, aged 16 or older serve as spotters for the riders, walking/light jogging alongside their camper. They help the rider to learn, keep their balance, steer, and most of all offer encouragement and motivation. The same two spotters work with the same child all week, so they truly share in the pride and joy of their success at the end of the week!! From increasing self esteem, to more inclusion in the community, to more physical fitness, to independent transportation, you will be helping these individuals in countless ways! Check it out: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5d82gFzxJOw&feature
07738.title: Help a child with a disability learn to ride a bike!

07430.description: Pony Power Therapies is looking for volunteers to assist in therapeutic horse-back riding lessons as lead walkers for our Summer Semester! Lead walkers are responsible for handling the horse during lessons and only those with previous horse experience will be assigned as Lead Walkers. Lessons run Monday through Thursday. Our Summer Semester begins on July 10th and runs through to August 24th. Available afternoon shifts (2:45 Pm to 6:00 PM or any time in between): Thursday, July 20th Monday, July 24th Thursday, July 27th Monday, July 31st Thursday, August 10th Monday, August 14th Thursday, August 17th Monday, August 21st Thursday, August 24 th UPCOMING TRANING CLASSES: Wednesday, July 5 th, 3:00 to 4:30 PM Thursday, July 6 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Sunday, July 9 th, 10:00 to 11:30 AM Volunteer Handbook, application and schedule will be emailed to you and application needs to be returned to our office prior to registering for a volunteer training class. Pony Power Therapies gives special needs and at-risk children and adults a unique opportunity to ride, care for and interact with horses. Our riding and non-riding activities enhance individuals' physical, social and emotional well-being in a safe, nurturing farm environment. Please visit www.ponypowernj.org for more information on Pony Power Therapies. Interested individuals can email volunteers@ponypowernj.org or call our office at 201-934-1001.

07302.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE The Fiscal Reviewer is part of a team of about 8 people who review each of the cases opened for clients after a fire. Normally it takes only a few minutes to check each case and certify that it meets the requirements for financial assistance; however, there are times the Team Member must get in contact with the Manager in charge of the county where the fire was, to get information corrected before the case can be passed through. OPEN TIME DAYS There are four 3 hour shifts each day, Monday through Friday; however, you don’t have to be available during the full hours, unless we are trying to meet a deadline. Shifts needed now are 9 to noon and/or noon to 3. REQUIRED TRAINING Disaster Cycle Services: An Overview Recovery Services: An Overview Direct Client Assistance Fundamentals Casework & Recovery Planning Fundamentals Meet the Client: What is a Family? Two Youtube videos (optional): Creating a Case and Recovery Planning Familiarization with a  job tool : ｠Fiscal Review Job Tool After you’ve finished the training, you will work with the Team Manager one on one to make sure you understand the whole process.｠ Once you are comfortable, you can take a couple shifts, always being able to communicate with the Manager if you have｠questions. ｠｠

07302.org: American Red Cross - New Jersey Region

07302.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Provide excellent and enthusiastic customer service to enhance the blood donor experience. Engage with blood donors to make the donation experience fulfilling and set the stage for a long-term commitment to regular blood donations. Understand the American Red Cross core mission, vision and values and represents these values through the delivery of excellent customer service. OPEN TIME DAYS Variable; Blood drives are 5 hours long REQUIRED TRAINING - Orientation to the American Red Cross - Donor Ambassador Training

07302.description: PLACEMENT PURPOSE Assist the Red Cross in delivering its mission of alleviating human suffering caused by disasters as a member of the Disaster Action Team. Meet the immediate needs of disaster clients such as food, clothing, shelter and other services which may be needed. OPEN TIME DAYS Actively sign up for on-call shifts each month. ｠Choose your availability, three shifts per month minimum. REQUIRED TRAINING Training is free. ｠Minimum training includes General Volunteer Orientation, Disaster Cycle Services: An Overview, Disaster Action Team Fundamentals and FEMA IS-100.b, Introduction to Incident Command System. ｠

11351.description: Looking for a person who is interested in Developmental Disabilities. Learn about personal outcomes and what really matters to the people that we serve.We need an individual who is able to do some data entry into our system; can read and speak English, can type and is computer savy. This oppurtunity is 12-15 hours pers week.
11351.title: Human Service Developmental Disabilities

11357.description: The Jimmy Fund/Variety Children’s Charities Theatre Collections Program is looking for local movie lovers with big hearts and a few spare hours to help raise money for cancer care and research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute this summer. Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at College Point Multiplex. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. Volunteers can earn exciting incentives from a volunteer t-shirt, to complimentary National Amusements movie passes, to Blue Many Group or Boston Red Sox tickets ( while supplies last)! Volunteer and learn more today - www.jimmyfund.org/theatre .
11357.title: Volunteer for The Jimmy Fund at College Point Multiplex in Whitestone, NY!

11693.description: Wheeling Forward helps people with disabilities experience life to the fullest and enables them to see possibility where others see insurmountable obstacles. They work with individuals to provide the advocacy, mentorship, and support services they need to reach their goals, no matter how big or small. Wheeling Forward and Life Rolls On will be having a \"They Will Surf Again\" adaptive surfing clinic at Rockaway Beach in Queens, NY for adults and children with all forms disabilities. Volunteers experienced in water sports and comfortable in the water are needed to assist the surfers. Volunteers are also needed onshore to assist participants.
11693.title: Assist a Person with a Disability to Surf Again!

11355.description: The YWCA of Queens Mobile Food Pantry distributes free , fresh fruit and vegetables to anyone in need in our community. Volunteers sort and bag fresh produce, assist with intake/enrollment process, distribute food to families and help with clean up at the end of event. Breakfast and lunch will be provided to volunteers
11355.title: Mobile Food Pantry

11355.description: Assist Technicians in Selfhelp’s \"Virtual Senior Center\" dept. with various duties including: a) entering info into database b) picking up computer systems from Seniors homes in Flushing, Queens area c) help with imaging computers. If you have good basic tech skills you’ll use them and learn more! Very friendly office environment working to provide homebound Seniors with activities by attending online classes via videochat. We supply the Seniors with Senior-friendly touch screen computers. If you live in or near the Flushing area, have friendly, patient demeanor, good tech skills, are at least 16 years old & can volunteer reliably for the summer for about 5-10 hours per week then this is for you! Also if you’re bi-lingual (English and Mandarin or Korean or Russian) that would be a help as well. Contact Carmella Chessen to find out more at cchessen@selfhelp.net or 646-259-4987
11355.title: Tech Ass’t. for Virtual Queens program

10038.description: The Refugee Resettlement Office of Catholic Charities Community Services provides assistance to refugees and asylees from diverse backgrounds, offering a variety of case management, employment, and educational services that help clients settle into their new community. To further help us with this goal the AmeriCorps VISTA member will be responsible for engaging volunteers, interns and parish/community/corporate volunteers to work with staff and support the programs. To read the full description, visit: http://www.catholiccharitiesnyvolunteer.org/NEW!
10038.title: AmeriCorps VISTA – Coordinator of Volunteers for New Americans
10038.org: Catholic Charities, Archdiocese of New York

10038.description: We are looking for volunteers with dance experience to help run a weekly movement-based creative workshop for students with intellectual disabilities in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn, Wednesdays from 11-12. This opportunity takes place over 12 weeks, for a small group of middle and high school students. The workshop will culminate with an informal showing. We are also looking for volunteer yoga instructors in all boroughs.
10038.title: Looking for Dance Teachers and Yoga Instructors

Now in its 68th year, the program launched in 1949 and is the Jimmy Fund’s oldest annual fundraising effort. Since its inception the program has raised more than $30 million. Volunteers are needed Monday - Sunday, June 9 to July 28, at Edgwater Multiplex. Volunteers will pass collection canisters to guests in movie theatres following a brief Jimmy Fund trailer. All contributions go directly to the Jimmy Fund, which supports lifesaving adult and pediatric patient care and cancer research at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute. 07960.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07960.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike!

07960.description: The volunteer experience at Good Grief is life changing. The children and families teach our facilitators a great deal about life, resiliency, hope, and the need for supporting each other. Many volunteers say they receive much more than they give. This meaningful experience not only impacts the children of Good Grief, but most facilitators attest to the ways in which this experience has drastically changed and improved their lives, as this work is both personally transformative and rewarding. #CHC
07960.title: Become a peer-support group facilitator for grieving children!

10005.description: Girl Vow, Inc is seeking volunteer women mentors who can conduct various gender-focused workshops or who are interested in mentoring a girl for an academic year. You must live in the NYC area. Please send an updated resume to the email address girlvow@gmail.com.
10005.title: Mentor Girls in the Foster Care & Juvenile Justice Systems

10305.description: Activity Specialist Geller House on Staten Island is a short-term residential diagnostic center that provides assessment, treatment, and aftercare planning for adolescents, ages 11 to 16, from all boroughs. Do you do what you love? Do you have hobbies and passions that can translate into skills for our teens? As an Activity Specialist, you will be able to turn a hobby or passion into a unique and rewarding volunteer opportunity. We are looking for volunteers (individual or group) that are interested in working with teens and teaching them a passion such as music, cosmetology, dance, arts visual or performing arts, or cooking. These are valuable skills for our teen clients to develop, and you may even help one of our clients discover a new lifelong passion of their own. Cosmetology (Nails, Hair, Makeup) No license is required, but a strong interest and background is preferred- 2.5 hours a week/bi-weekly. Basic Computer Skills (for clients and staff) No background necessary, just ability to teach computer operation basics to new users- 2.5 hours a week/bi-weekly. Arts and Crafts (Art Therapy) Lead art projects with the help of our staff- 2.5 hours a week/bi-weekly. Dance/Music Group Lead music class. Share and teach your dancing, singing, and other performing arts skills- 2.5 hours a week/bi-weekly. Cooking Instructor Teach residents how to make simple, healthy, and fun recipes-2.5 hours a week/bi-weekly. Assistant Fitness Instructor Help lead a fitness class/activity -2.5 hours a week/bi-weekly. Mondays, Wednedays,Thursdays and Fridays 3pm-8pm. Tuesdays 5:45pm-8pm. Saturday and Sunday between 2pm -8pm( hours are flexible).
10305.title: Activity Specialist
10305.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10550.description: The Network for Teaching Entrepreneurship provides programs that inspire young people from low-income communities to stay in school, to recognize business opportunities and to plan for successful futures by teaching the entrepreneurial mindset. This summer, volunteer as a Business Plan Coach with NFTE NY Metro and work one-on-one with students preparing for the BizCamp Competition on August 10, 2017. As a coach, you will meet with a student and provide feedback as they prepare to pitch their business plan at the Finals for the chance to win cash prizes.
10550.title: NFTE Westchester Business Plan Coach

10029.description: We're looking for several people to volunteer with our Meals on Wheels program on Saturday, July 8th! We welcome both individual volunteers and small groups. For over 40 years, Union Settlement has provided Meals on Wheels to East Harlem's older residents that are often economically struggling and living alone. Our Meals on Wheels program currently serves approximately 450 homebound seniors each day. Prior to the volunteer date, volunteers will be sent a short training video and brief quiz to help prepare them for participation with Meals on Wheels. Volunteers will help pack hot and cold meals and then join staff on deliveries where they will get to hand out meals to our clients and interact with the East Harlem community. When: Saturday, July 8th from 8:30am to 12:30pm Where: Jefferson Senior Center in East Harlem Interested individuals or groups should email volunteers@unionsettlement.org with the subject line \"Saturday, July 8th Meals on Wheels Volunteer\". Volunteers are not required to have a driver's license or own a car.
10029.title: Volunteer with Meals on Wheels on Saturday, July 8th!

10029.description: Volunteer in Our Summer Program & Support Our Scholars! EHTP seeks passionate volunteers to work with elementary and middle school students during our summer program! Our summer program runs Monday through Friday, and volunteers play a huge role in making the summer successful. Volunteers can choose between the morning or afternoon shifts or do a full day. In the morning, volunteers support our teachers and scholars during academic instruction. In the afternoons, volunteers support during field trips, outdoor activities, and enrichment clubs such as comics, drama, dance, and sports. Volunteers must commit to a minimum of 3 shifts a week or 2 full days for the full 4 weeks of program. When : July 6 - August 3, Monday - Friday Times : 7:45am - 12:00pm (Morning) and/or 12:00pm - 4:00pm (Afternoon) All interested volunteers should apply online here: https://ehtp.cloud.talentedk12.com/hire/ViewJob.aspx?JobID=36 If you have any questions, please contact our Associate, Volunteers & Interns, Raul Lazo, at volunteerinfo@ehtp.org Requirements Volunteers must be at least 14 years old Summer Program is a highly active environment and volunteers must be able to climb multiple flights of stairs, carry heavy boxes, stand for a minimum of 4 hours a day, feel comfortable supervising children in outdoor and indoor settings, and participate in physical activities such as running and sports Acceptance contingent on clearance of a Criminal Background and Medical Check (forms provided during application process)
10029.title: Volunteer in Our Summer Program & Support Our Scholars!

10029.description: Harlem RBI, an award winning youth development program, is seeking volunteer T-ball coaches to work with youth ages 5-7 in practices and games. Coaches teach T-ball and provide youth with opportunities to play, learn and grow; inspiring them to recognize their potential and realize their dreams. Each coach serves as a member of a small coaching staff. There are powerful rewards gained from the Harlem RBI coaching experience. Harlem RBI volunteer coaches can have a direct and noticeable impact on the positive development of the youth they coach. The ideal candidate is passionate about youth development, has experience working with youth, and can commit to attending six Saturday practices and games in July/August, as well as a one-day pre-season coaches training on June 25 th. Roles and Responsibilities Guide a team of 16-18 youth through practices and games; Ensure youth safety on the field; Provide a fun and positive, team-based environment; Attend all practices and games on six Saturdays in July and August. Qualifications Passionate about youth development; Understand the power of teamwork; Have the ability to create a positive, team-based environment focused on teaching T-ball; Organized, energetic and flexible; Skilled communicators; Experience in baseball/softball a plus; Able to commit to six Saturdays, in July and August; At least 18 years of age. Hours: Coaches conduct practices and games for an hour and a half on six Saturday mornings or afternoons from 7/9/16 to 8/13/16. Coaches must be able to commit to attend all six Saturday coaching sessions during the summer, as well as the coach training day in June. Harlem RBI provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
10029.title: Volunteer T-Ball Coaches!

11226.description: Work with Adult Literacy Students at one of the five Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers. Help them reach their personal goals. Lead reading and writing activities for small groups of adult learners who read below the fifth grade level. Assist them in using technology. We provide a 20 hour Volunteer Tutor Training where you will learn the BPL’s Literacy Program’s philosophy, how to use the library’s resources for instruction, and how to create effective lesson plans. Professional staff will encourage your development in this richly rewarding field. Volunteers must have a high school diploma or equivalent and a love of reading and writing. Volunteers are asked for a one year commitment to tutoring either 2 - 2 hours sessions, or 1 - 3-hour session per week. To learn more about the Brooklyn Public Library Learning Centers, please visit the BPL website at http://www.bklynpubliclibrary.org/support/volunteer/adult-literacy-volunteer-tutor .
11226.title: Volunteer Tutor Information Session
11226.org: The Learning Centers @ Brooklyn Public Library

11226.description: We are looking for an organ player to play our new Allen Organ Theater II. Time is every Sunday at 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM.
11226.title: Organist Wanted

10024.description: Volunteer tutors needed for low income students for summer session from 7/5/17-8/18/17. You will be matched one-to-one for just two hours per week. Students range in age from 7-18. There are no weekend hours available.
10024.title: Help a Child!  Be a Summer Volunteer Tutor

10024.description: Since 2001 DOROT’s prestigious Summer Teen Internship Program has been inspiring high school students to become leaders and give back to the community. Volunteer with a diverse group of socially-conscious high school students to help local seniors connect. The internship is designed to provide students with a minimum of 92 hours of community service. * Documentary Filmaking - Session I * Intergenerational Theater - Session II * Deliver meals and birthday cakes * Teach computer skills * Cook and dine with seniors * Plan intergenerational trips to local museums * 104 hours of community service Session 1: June 26 - July 20 (exceptions made for regents exams) Session 2: July 24 - August 17 Apply here: www.dorotusa.org/teenapp Watch a Day in the Life of a DOROT Teen Intern: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jeXyE2YSHCM ''It’s an incredibly fulfilling experience to reach out to the seniors in the community and help them with whatever they need assistance with. It's also an added benefit that, as teen interns, we can build relationships with other teens who love the same service work. -Maude, Summer Teen Intern The DOROT Summer Teen Internship Program is jointly funded by UJA-Federation of New York and the Jim Joseph Foundation. The Jewish Education Project serves as lead operator of the Initiative.
10024.title: Summer Teen Internship Program 2017

10024.description: myFace is proud to host Races For Faces 2017! Please join us on Sunday, July 23, for a fun-filled family day in beautiful Riverside Park on the Upper West Side of Manhattan to raise money and awareness for craniofacial conditions. Meeting Point: The Warsaw Ghetto Memorial at 83rd Street Event Schedule: 7:00 AM - Volunteers Arrive and Check-In 9:00 AM - Registration Begins 10:00 AM - Opening Remarks 10:30 AM - Walk Commencement & Carnival Fun! 12:00 PM - Closing Ceremony & Awards We will have lots of fun for children of all ages including exciting games, family activities and raffle, arts and crafts, obstacle courses and lots of surprises! Every dollar donated goes towards helping patients with craniofacial differences and their families! To learn more, please visit www.racesforfaces.org
10024.title: Races for Faces 2017

10025.description: Whether you're great, good or fair at Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM), you can help make an impact on inner-city youth. Here's how: The Parris Foundation S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program has returned for the Spring 2017 session. The program began after a successful summer pilot in 2012, and our subsequent programs have grown to continue to serve middle school students and high school students . With the growing impact on the community, we need your support to continue to bring STEM to our middle school and high school youth throughout New York City. As we expand to more locations to serve more youth, there is a growing need for volunteers! How we do it: The Parris Foundation curriculum combines innovative and interactive software and teaching techniques with hand-ons interdisciplinary experiments and activities to keep our students engaged with their passion for science and math! About The Parris Foundation: The Parris Foundation is dedicated to promoting educational opportunities and fostering awareness in science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through scholarships and community outreach programs. The Parris Foundation's S.T.E.M.ulating Minds: Weekend Enrichment Programs provide extended learning opportunities to supplement and enhance in-school learning.
10025.title: Summer 2017 - S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program

10025.description: The New Jewiish Home, Manhattan Division has a wide variety of opportunities for high school and college students to volunteer with over the summer vacation. Opportunities vary and we will try our best to meet your interest Opportunities include but not limited to: Recreation Assistant (Bingo, Games, Exercise, Arts & Crafts, Nail Spa) Pharamacy (selective, limited spots) Library Assistant (upkeep of shelving, assisting book selections, assisting computer users) Clerical/Office Assistant Please apply online at the following link: https://www.volgistics.com/ex/portal.dll/ap?AP=229551104 Please mention Volunteer Match & Summer Volunteering in your application If you have any questions - Please contact Jessica at JSinovoi@jewishhome.org
10025.title: Summer Volunteer at The New Jewish Home (HS & College students)
10025.org: The New Jewish Home, Manhattan Division

10025.description: BECOME A SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, ENGINEERING and MATH (STEM) VOLUNTEER! Help middle school and high school students develop a passion for math and science by becoming a dedicated instructor, teaching assistant, or afterschool tutor. Whether you're great, good or fair at Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM), you can help make an impact on inner-city youth. Here's how: The Parris Foundation S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program has returned for the Spring 2017 session . The program began after a successful summer pilot in 2012, and our subsequent programs have grown to continue to serve middle school students and high school students . With the growing impact on the community, we need your support to continue to bring STEM to our middle school and high school youth throughout New York City . As we expand to more locations to serve more youth, there is a growing need for volunteers! Our ideal volunteer is enthusiastic about working with youth, can commit to multiple Saturdays, and possesses, at minimum, basic science and math skills. No previous education experience is required. Your passion for science and math coupled with a desire to help New York City youth realize their true potential is all that is required.
10025.title: Spring & Summer 2017 - S.T.E.M.ulating Minds Weekend Enrichment Program

11223.description: The Care Management program is seeking Data Entry Specialists who are able to perform extensive data entry into 3 different electronic health records and a variety of Microsoft Excel spreadsheets in order to accurately track and manage the care coordination services provided to our clients. We seek volunteers who: - Are computer literate and knowledgeable of recent Microsoft Excel updates. - Have experience with data entry. - Are able to treat Protected Health Information confidentially & with good judgment. - Are willing to be trained to utilize electronic health records. This opportunity is available on Mondays-Fridays from 9am-5pm. Time commitment and hours are flexible within the hours of operation.
11223.title: Data Entry Specialist
11223.org: Jewish Board of Family and Children's Services

10023.description: Do you want to SEE beyond the declining level of dialogue in the world to what (actually) is real in everyday items of news? This free news sheet is being made available by the Global Center for Human Change at a time when confidence in the veracity of even the basic facts about our world has sunk to an all-time low. 'The REAL News' shows the principles upon which constructive dialogue and the fashioning of a new world built on those principles can take place. It does NOT reflect partisan bias or seek to make any point about current political positioning - it is forward thinking only, beyond the current fixed line of conflict and critique. Do you want to SEE what (actually) is real in everyday items of news at a time when we urgently need to see clearly? Each week, 'The REAL News Team’, together with Philosopher and Writer, Richard A. Bowell, take a news story from around the world and show what really is occurring in these times within the context of our evolution and the way to contribute consciously to a new world. Volunteers will become trained in these sessions in the way to SEE what (really) is real in the news, beyond the alarmist or sensationalist portrayal of news we have grown to think is normal. Applications will be accepted until noon on Saturday, 20 May. Successful applicants will be invited to our live training session in New York City on Thursday, May 25 (8pm). JOIN us today! Never before have we needed to be able to SEE our human situation on this planet within the context of our evolution as NOW! Click here for a sample of our weekly news sheet: http://mailchi.mp/globalcenterforhumanchange.org/seeing-what-is-real-news-issue-1-may-1-993549 The Global Center for Human Change is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit organization in the USA.
10023.title: Seeking 20 Volunteers To Join Our News Team And Help Deliver The REAL News!

11221.description: ACE Integration Head Start is looking for a person to assist in updating their web page , printed materials, E.g. Brochures - Flyers and Parent Handbooks.
11221.title: Writer -Content Manager Web /Brochure

10021.description: Help support us in feeding New York City's homeless population! We are looking for volunteers who can commit to regularly support our mission. Volunteers will assist in stocking our food pantry, sorting incoming delivieries, and donations, as well as creating food packages for homeless, and low income individuals. Last year, the Urban Outreach Center distributed over 12,000lbs of food, and supported over 27,000 homeless men, women, and children in the NYC area, but we need your help to continue this mission. Please visit our website http://www.uocnyc.org/ for more details. *Volunteers must be able to traverse stairs, and able to lift weights up to 55lbs. Sturdy footwear is essentials.*
10021.title: Support our Community Food Pantry
10021.org: Jan Hus Presbyterian Church & Neighborhood House

11219.description: The role of a volunteer at Maimonides Infants and Children’s Hospital is to provide supplemental service to the staff and to fill the multiple needs of the child and family while in the hospital. Volunteers at Maimonides Infants & Children’s Hospital are assigned by the Department of Volunteer Services and while on duty are directly responsible to the Child Life Supervisor/Designee. Child Life volunteers are prepared to function independently providing play, recreational, and supportive activities to children and their families on the Pediatric unit they are trained to. These activities assist in making patients feel safe and comfortable. Volunteers serve in the playroom as well as at the bedside when requested. Specific Volunteer Opportunities Available: Skilled Group Leader - If you have a special skill you would like to share with our families like music, singing, arts & crafts, knitting, scrapbooking, storytelling, puppetry, etc. ( 2 hours a week for at Least 6 months) Volunteer in Play Room or Teen Room- Help provide materials at bedside and play or do arts and crafts with children and teens in the play areas.( 4 hours a week for at least 6 months)
11219.title: Playroom Volunteer

08837.description: Canine Companions for Independence has an opening for an Event Chair and DogFest committee to lead the planning of the 2017 DogFest New Jersey Walk N Roll. Event Chair must be available to meet once a month for committee meetings and have ability to assist committee members in soliciting sponsors, recruiting teams and participants and publicizing the event. Position description is below but subject to change. Event Chair candidates will need to meet with Canine Companions staff before being accepted for the position. DogFest Chairperson Work with Staff Partner to identify and recruit Committee Chairs. With the Committee Chairs, recruit volunteers to fill committee positions. Manage the committee through the planning process. Communicate with Staff Partner to ensure they are in the loop through the entire process. Serve as spokesperson for DogFest in the community Organization and communication skills to coordinate and lead committee meetings Have a well-developed network of potential sponsors, vendors and committee members Creativity to come up with ideas for fund-raising Ability to participate in meetings during work days and evenings both by phone and face to face in Irving Follow up skills needed to keep various committee info updated and on track Passion for the cause because it will come out in the message presented Ability and willingness to speak in public meetings and at Canine Companions events to promote DogFest and drive committee membership and event participation Ability to assist committee in soliciting sponsorships, recruiting teams and participants and publicizing event Previous event planning and fundraising experience helpful
08837.title: Dogfest Walk 'n Roll Chairperson or commitee member
08837.org: CANINE COMPANIONS FOR INDEPENDENCE - NORTHEAST REGION (Maine to Virginia)

08837.description: We are a non-profit looking for positive-minded adult volunteers of all ages to help with various projects for our growing organization. The hours are flexible - come when you can, stay as long as you like - just let us know. We need talents of all types from social media friendly to data entry savvy volunteers and everything in between. Join us in our exciting new Education Center in Raritan Center Business Park in Edison and meet our wonderful staff who are dedicated to our mission of empowering young people to own their economic success. Learn more about us at www.janj.org
08837.title: Social media savvy or more traditional ?  We need you!

07726.description: **NEW - ORIENTATION IS IN PRINCETON, NJ ON JULY 16th! APPLY NOW TO RESERVE A SEAT AT THE ORIENTATION!** ACCEPTING ONLY 10 MORE STUDENTS FOR NEW 2017 CLASS REGISTER BEFORE JUNE 30th, 2017 The Advanced Clinical Triage Squad (ACTS) consists of talented students in New Jersey who are prepared with the knowledge to quickly act in traumatic medical emergencies. The ACT squad accepts candidates year-round on an ongoing basis. EMRs. Who We Are. What We Do. Emergency Medical Responders (EMRs) are elite trained and certified personnel equipped with basic life support skills, event medicine experience, and trauma skills with a mastery in triage. Any current high school student is welcome to apply for free ACTS training, however, the application process is very selective. All candidates undergo a rigorous medical boot camp, the exact curriculum can be viewed at apply.actsquad.org After successful completion of the free ASHI training program, the standardized written exam (Part 1), and the psychomotor assessment (Part 2), the applicant will be certified as an official recognized Emergency Medical Responder with the Advanced Clinical Triage Squad. To learn more about the Advanced Clinical Triage Squad , visit actsquad.org Please submit to us your full name, currently enrolled high school, date of birth, phone number, email, and your reason for volunteering with us. REQUIREMENTS: Must be a current high school student. Must possess Basic Life Support (BLS) or CPR at the Professional Rescuer Level Certification by either the AHA, ASHI, or NSC. Regular CPR certification is not accepted. As a volunteer applicant, you are eligible to receive a discount of $40 off BLS certification if you choose to receive it from us (regular price: $85). We are an Authorized American Safety & Health Institute (ASHI) Training Provider. Please specify that when inquiring with us, or book a class with four or more at courses.wearehames.com
07726.title: Emergency Medical Responder (Free Training & Certification!)
07726.org: High School Association of Medical Engineers & Scientists, Inc.

10990.description: We are still accepting volunteers for week long volunteer experience that will change your life. The Warwick Conference Center's is a christian center, in New York's beautiful Hudson Valley, with a mission to provide a safe and fun environment for children and adults to grow in there faith. The position is for Volunteering a week at a time with individuals ages 8-55 with developmental and physical disabilities. Sleep away Camp involving arts and crafts, recreational games, christian education, swimming, singing, hiking and field trips. You will be trained in all aspects of disabilities and personal care before starting. For more information and to apply visit CampWarwick.com. 9th, 12th, college age students and Adults are welcome to inquire.

11420.description: Each year, Making Strides Against Breast Cancer kicks-off its season by hosting a morning event for our Team Leaders to learn about Strides, hear inspiring speakers, receive their Team Leader Kit, and more. This year, our kickoff is held at its new location: Resorts World Casino NYC Event Space. In attendance will be sponsors, volunteers, fundraisers, team leaders, and community members new to the event. We need volunteers to help us on the day of the event. Roles include, but are not limited to: *Greeters *Check-In *Ushers *Table Captains *Merch *Clean-up (All roles) If you are able to support our kickoff, please respond so we can reach out to you and confirm details. For more informaiton, email QueensNYStrides@cancer.org. Thank you for your volunteerism!
11420.title: Kickoff Event Volunteer
