10471.description: \"I realized the kids from my generation have the power to make a huge difference in someone's life.\" -Sabrina, Summer Teen Intern DOROT's prestigious Summer Teen Internship Program is expanding to the Riverdale Y. The Summer Teen Internship inspires high school students to develop leadership skills and give back to their community. Volunteer with a diverse group of socially-conscious high school students to facilitate intergenerational programs at the Riverdale Y Senior Center. Interns will: Learn to create documentary films Teach computer classes Facilitate classes Achieve 105 hours of community service Dates: Sunday, July 23: Orientation and Training 10:00am - 5:00pm July 24 - August 10 Monday - Thursday 10:00am - 5:00pm *On the last day of the internship, the day ends at 6:30pm. Additional pre-program opportunity in Manhattan! Ask us about it! To learn more, go to www.dorotusa.org/teenapp Contact: Dara Garcia at DGarcia@RiverdaleY.org or 347-913-4440 The Riverdale Y - DOROT Summer Teen Internship Program is jointly funded by UJA-Federation of New York and the Jim Joseph Foundation. The Jewish Education Project serves as lead operator of the Initiative.
10471.title: Riverdale Y - DOROT Summer Teen Internship

11726.description: Camp Adventure is a one-week sleep away camp that takes place on Shelter Island at the Quinipet Camp and Retreat Center. Every year we have a theme with over-the-top events, like personal fireworks shows, concerts and carnivals. It is completely run by volunteers, including our medical team. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals have allowed even children who are critically ill to experience camp. Camp Adventure is for children ages 6 - 18. Young people 17 - 18 can take part in our Leadership in Training and Counselor in Training programs, that operate year-round. This landmark children’s oncology camp, is MoRE than a program to its members, it is what we lovingly refer to as our \"Camp Family\".
11726.title: Do MoRE for KiDS with Cancer

11721.description: This July, Good Shepherd Hospice and the Bob Sweeney Foundation present their annual Camp HOPE. This 2 day Camp hosts 80 school aged children who have experienced the loss of a close loved one. The Camp boasts a professional staff of grief counselors who help the children to process their loss and develop coping skills. The Camp would not be possible without the volunteers who give of their time and talent to make these young people feel safe special and supported. Each volunteer is assigned as a Personal Pal to a child, who they work one-on-one with for the entire two days. This relationship ensures that each child is given all of the special attention they deserve. In addition to three, hour long grief groups, the children participate in typical Camp activities, including sports, recreation, and arts and crafts. The opening and closing ceremonies celebrate bravery and hope, encouraging these beautiful children to support one another and remember their loved ones as they walk through life. Volunteers are needed to help make this year's Camp a success. For more information or to be added to our distribution lists, please contact the Volunteer Department at 631-828-7611. We look forward to hearing from you!
11721.title: Camp HOPE 2017

07068.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07068.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike

06906.description: Telephone support volunteers assist staff with making phone calls to our patients and their families for follow up and offer emotional support to assist patients and their families with whatever the needs are after signing on to hospice care. If you are a person who demonstrates the ability to communicate with people effectively, listens to others, has absolute integrity and the use of good judgment to handle the professional and confidential nature of assignments, then Caring Hospice of Connecticut located in Stamford, Connecticut is the right fit for you. Caring Hospice Services of Connecticut is a unique, holistic and cost effective service designed to meet the social, emotional, spiritual and physical needs of their patients and families in Fairfield county who reside in private homes, nursing homes and assisted-living facilities as they face terminal illness. We are looking for individuals who enjoy helping people, and are willing to commit to a consistent schedule a few hours per week or every other week. Individualized training is provided free of charge. In keeping with Medicare requirements, background and medical checks are part of the training process.
06906.title: Enjoy listening?  Become a telephone support volunteer!

We have a small patch of grass/dirt and also a raised wooden planter that need some TLC in the form of shovels and perhaps topsoil We will pay for the soil and plants but we're looking for someone to do the \"dirty\" work. ' If you love a garden, don't mind an audience, and enjoy mingling with the senior crowd, then you're the one for us. Please call. We are here 24/7 and are very flexible with dates, days or times. Thank you!!!!
06902.title: Anyone out there willing to make us a garden??

06902.description: We have a gentlemen veteran here at Brighton Gardens of Stamford who sits week after week waiting for other veterans to join him. He likes to hear stories and also tell his own story. If you can spare a half hour on Thursdays at 11, please let me know. It doesn't have to be every week, just something for him to look forward to. He's a very nice man, he insists on wearing his veteran hat and reads the sports page waiting to see if someone shows up. Call or email if you are interested. Thank you!
06902.title: Veterans Welcome here at Brighton Gardens Stamford

06903.description: Media/News Writer Volunteer, If you enjoy writing, this is the volunteer job for you. We are looking for someone to create press releases about the Stamford History Center for distribution to various media outlets (onlinenews sites, radio, tv, magazines, etc.). You will interview people in the organization to gather information. Once your article is reviewed by our volunteer editors, it will be sent out. It is essential that our media volunteer stays up-to- date with our activities, so press releases go out in a timely fashion. The position can be expanded to include the creation of newsletters and flyers (working with our graphic designer). This is a job that can be done largely from your own laptop/desktop, and at your own convenience. REQUIREMENT: Please write a two or three paragraph \"Press Release\" on one of the following topics: 1] About our Tag Sale 2] The opening of the Hoyt-Barnum House or 3] A past Historical Center event You can get ideas by going to our web site: www.stamfordhistory.org Forward it to me and we will review and get back to you. Thanks again for your interest in joining the volunteer team! Tom Tom Porter Volunteer Coordinator Stamford History Center 1508 High Ridge Road Stamford, CT 06903 www.stamfordhistory.org 203-329-1183 Skills needed: organized, experienced writer; a self-starter who can use Word and navigate the internet.
06903.title: Media/News Writer Volunteer

06903.description: Museum Docent We are looking for volunteers who would like to introduce visitors to our 1699 historic house museum. You would be involved with greeting visitors with a smile and giving a brief explanation of the Center's offerings: a research library, photo archive, our current exhibit, and our historic house museum. People who wish to tour Hoyt-Barnum House first view an introductory film before starting the audio tour. You would be responsible for selling tickets and recording transactions, giving guests their audio pods and collecting them after the tours, opening and closing up the house museum, and monitoring visitors while they are in the house. Training is provided. Museum Docents should be friendly and personable. They should be physically able to manage stairs and brief walks on a regular basis. Docents should be at least 20 years old and able to work at least one four-hour day, 2 x /month. Shifts are from noon to 4 pm on Thursdays and Fridays. Two docents are needed on Saturday: one from 10:30 - 2:30 and one from noon to 4 pm. You are welcome to stay longer to meet our other volunteers and make use of our facility. Skills Customer Service Public Speaking General Education Problem Solving Communication Basic math/money skills
06903.title: Museum Docent

06901.description: Seeking volunteer transport drivers with reliable vehicles to help us move dogs along our transport route between these towns: Hagerstown MD, Mechanicsburg PA, Hamburg PA, Phillipsburg NJ, Haskell NJ (northern NJ), Stamford CT, E Hartford CT. Transports are on Saturdays and we move through these towns during afternoon/evening hours. MUST LOVE DOGS. Must be comfortable handling strange dogs that may or may not be stressed by transport. Attention to detail important. Not above cleaning up stinky messes to help our furry friends get to safety. Crates are required but not provided. On occasion we are able to get some crates donated. Please submit a driver application: http://form.jotform.us/form/50214993744156
06901.title: Saturday transport driver near Stamford CT

This is a great opportunity to teach those who suffer from substance abuse, other coping mechanisms and ways to reduce stress naturally. It is also a great way to build experience in your field.

11797.description: Are you passionate in the fight to save lives and help create a world without cancer? Do you want to be a part of the official kickoff to breast cancer awareness season in Long Island? Event: The Corporate Breakfast is a high-energy, inspirational event where Team Leaders come to celebrate breast cancer survivors, learn about our research achievements, and discover the local programs and services we offer. Last year, the Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Corporate Kickoff Breakfast welcomed 1,000 guests, including 200 survivors. Breakfast attendees are team leaders from a variety of different industries, including Fortune 500 companies, large corporations, small local businesses, health systems, as well as members of the community. Description: The Making Strides of Long Island is seeking 10 volunteers to support our staff during the kickoff. Duties include but not limited to: *Final decorating details *Check-in of guests *Merchandise sales *Distribution of Team Leader gift *Collection of registration forms *Assistance with online registration (training provided) *Packing up and loading event materials *Photography of event Expectations: *Attire: Business Appropriate (not casual or business casual) *Arrive at venue between 6:30-6:45 AM for final instructions *Plan to stay until all materials packed and loaded into transport cars *Typically a modest spread of breakfast items are provided for staff & volunteers on a rotating basis, however please plan accordingly and come with energy to complete the morning For more information about this or other volunteer opportunties with the American Cancer Society, please call 1-800-227-2345 and mention you saw this post. Also, view our Volunteer Match profile for more opportunities. ------------------------------------------------------------------ The American Cancer Society's Making Strides Against Breast Cancer walks raise awareness and funds to save lives from breast cancer. The Making Strides of Long Island bring together more than 80.000 local participants and have raised more than $2,5 Million annually.
11797.title: Corporate Kickoff Volunteer

10019.description: The National Chorale is a premier NYC choral organization, founded 49 years ago, made up of an Ensemble of professional singers and soloists. Our annual concert series is presented in David Geffen Hall at Lincoln Center. We also present choral performances in other NYC venues as well as at other local, national and international festivals and music events and conferences. We also have a K-12 music training program where we provide professional music teachers in local NYC public schools. Our Executive Director is underwater with her workload, some of which we would like to offload to Administrative / Clerical Assistants. Work ranges from researching items on the Internet, to answering phones, to preparing reports, to scheduling events and people, to occasionally running an errand, typing - letters and reports and input to our database, attending meetings, communicating with our audience members, Board Members, concert personnel, funders, sponsors and K-12 NYC school administrators and teachers. Folks who have worked in the corporate environment with experienced office skills would be ideal. Office is in midtown Manhattan (Broadway & West 51st Street. Friendly office environment. Prefer a minimum of 20 hours per week, but we will work with you to design a schedule that is comfortable for you. We really need your help and like most nonprofit organizations, cannot afford to hire the support staff we require. BTW, one of the perks for our volunteers is that they are provided with two tickets to every Lincoln Center concert, and more if needed! Come join us and know that you will be making a real impact with a deserving nonprofit organization!
10019.title: Administrative / Clerical Help

11714.description: Would prefer someone who is bilingual (English and Spanish), but this is not required. Must have means of transpiration (car, means to access to rail, bus, etc.) The responsibilities would include: Answering phone Screening and transferring phone calls using basic switch board Experience with Microsoft Office (excel, word, outlook 365) Greeting clients and families, needs to be comfortable and friendly. Locking up at end of night (only if we need a volunteer for the late shift) Other requirements: Must be able to multitask and handle high pressure situations, it can get hectic up there Clerical experience (min 1 year) Submit to background check, etc. We are typically looking for someone who would be available to fill in for an hour or so when needed (all staff meetings, when we have events, retreats, etc.) We are usually able to give significant notice, but I would prefer someone with a very flexible schedule who is close enough in proximity to the agency to be able to come in with little notice.
11714.title: Reception
